 ALL  Windows graphics in a sandbox

TXLib.h

См. документацию.

00136 #define _TX_VER      _TX_v_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 168, 2020-08-13 00:46:05 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
00137 #define _TX_VERSION  _TX_V_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 168, 2020-08-13 00:46:05 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
00138 #define _TX_AUTHOR   _TX_A_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 168, 2020-08-13 00:46:05 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
00139 
00141 #define _TX_v_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2)  ((0x##ver##u << 16) | 0x##rev##u)
00142 #define _TX_V_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2)  "TXLib [Ver: " #ver ", Rev: " #rev ", Date: " #date "]"
00143 #define _TX_A_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2)  "Copyright (C) " auth

00168     #define _GCC_VER          ( __GNUC__*100 + __GNUC_MINOR__*10 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__ )
00169 
00170     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "GNU g++ "            TX_QUOTE (__GNUC__)       "."  \
00171                                                     TX_QUOTE (__GNUC_MINOR__) "."  \
00172                                                     TX_QUOTE (__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) \
00173                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00174 
00175 #elif  defined (__clang__) || defined (__clang_major__)
00176 
00177     #define _CLANG_VER        ( __clang_major__*100 + __clang_minor__*10 + __clang_patchlevel__ )
00178 
00179     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "Clang "              TX_QUOTE (__clang_major__) "."  \
00180                                                     TX_QUOTE (__clang_minor__) "."  \
00181                                                     TX_QUOTE (__clang_patchlevel__) \
00182                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)

00184 
00185     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "MSVS "               TX_QUOTE (_MSC_VER)            \
00186                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00187

00189 
00190     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "Intel C++ "          TX_QUOTE (__INTEL_COMPILER)    \
00191                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00192 #else
00193 
00194     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "Unknown C++, std="   TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00195     #endif

00238 
00239 #define __TX_FILELINE__       __FILE__ " (" TX_QUOTE (__LINE__) ")"
00240 
00241 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00249 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00250 
00251 #if defined (__GNUC__) || defined (__clang__) || defined (__clang_major__)
00252     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
00253 
00254 #elif defined (__FUNCSIG__)
00255     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNCSIG__
00256 
00257 #elif defined (__FUNCTION__)
00258     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNCTION__
00259 
00260 #elif defined (__INTEL_COMPILER) && (__INTEL_COMPILER >= 600)
00261     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNCTION__
00262 
00263 #elif defined (__BORLANDC__) && (__BORLANDC__ >= 0x550)
00264     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNC__
00265 
00266 #elif defined (__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 199711L)
00267     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __func__
00268 
00269 #elif defined (__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L)
00270     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __func__
00271 
00272 #elif defined (__PYTHON__)
00273     #error No Python. No. Using parseltongue languages can lead you to Slytherin.
00274 
00275 #else
00276     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   "(" __TX_FILELINE__ ")"
00277 
00278 #endif
00279 
00280 #if !defined (__func__) && defined (__FUNCTION__)
00281     #define   __func__        __FUNCTION__
00282 
00283 #endif
00284

00296     #ifdef __GNUC__
00297     #error
00298     #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00299     #endif
00300     #error TXLib.h: Must use C++ to compile TXLib.h. Now you are using C only.
00301     #error
00302     #error CHECK source file EXTENSION. Maybe it is ".C". It must be ".CPP".
00303     #error If your file is named, for example, "Untitled.C", go to menu [File],
00304     #error then [Save As] and rename it to "Untitled.CPP". Please do NOT use spaces.
00305     #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00306     #error
00307 
00308 #endif

00497         #define _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG
00498     #endif
00499 
00500     #ifndef     _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG                  // TXLib enables _GLIBCXX_DEBUG by default. When using third-party libraries
00501         #define _GLIBCXX_DEBUG                   // compiled without _GLIBCXX_DEBUG (SFML, for example), #define _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG
00502         #define _GLIBCXX_DEBUG_PEDANTIC          // *before* including TXLib.h.
00503     #endif
00504 
00505     #if defined (_WIN64)                         // removed in x86 because printf ("%lg", double) failure, this prints 0 always
00506     #ifndef     __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO

00508     #endif
00509     #endif
00510 
00511     template <typename T>
00512     inline T _txNOP (T value)          { return value; }   // To suppress performance warnings in assert etc.
00513 
00514     // From MinGW\include\float.h which is replaced by MinGW\lib\gcc\i686-pc-mingw32\x.x.x\include\float.h
00515     extern "C" __declspec (dllimport)  unsigned __cdecl _controlfp (unsigned control, unsigned mask);
00516     extern "C"                         void     __cdecl _fpreset   ();
00517 
00518 #else
00519 
00520     #define     __attribute__( attr )
00521     #define     _txNOP( value )        ( value )
00522 
00523 #endif

00610 #if  defined (_MSC_VER)
00611 
00612     #pragma warning (push, 4)                    // Set maximum warning level. This 'push' is to set the level only. It will NOT be popped.
00613 
00614     #pragma warning (disable:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
00615 
00616     #pragma warning (disable:    4514)           // Unreferenced inline function has been removed
00617     #pragma warning (disable:    4710)           // Function not inlined
00618     #pragma warning (disable:    4786)           // Identifier was truncated to '255' characters in the debug information
00619 
00620     #pragma warning (error:      4715)           // Not all control paths return a value
00621 
00622     #pragma warning (default:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
00623 
00624     // These warning settings for TXLib.h only and will be re-enabled at end of file:
00625 
00626     #pragma warning (push)
00627 
00628     #pragma warning (disable:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
00629 
00630     #pragma warning (disable:    4091)           // 'typedef': ignored on left of '...' when no variable is declared
00631     #pragma warning (disable:    4124)           // Using __fastcall with stack checking is ineffective
00632     #pragma warning (disable:    4127)           // Conditional expression is constant
00633     #pragma warning (disable:    4200)           // Nonstandard extension used: zero-sized array in struct/union
00634     #pragma warning (disable:    4201)           // Nonstandard extension used: nameless struct/union
00635     #pragma warning (disable:    4351)           // New behavior: elements of array will be default initialized
00636     #pragma warning (disable:    4480)           // Nonstandard extension used: specifying underlying type for enum 'type'
00637     #pragma warning (disable:    4481)           // Nonstandard extension used: override specifier 'override'
00638     #pragma warning (disable:    4555)           // Result of expression not used
00639     #pragma warning (disable:    4611)           // Interaction between '_setjmp' and C++ object destruction is non-portable
00640     #pragma warning (disable:    5045)           // Compiler will insert Spectre mitigation for memory load if /Qspectre switch specified
00641     #pragma warning (disable:    6269)           // Possibly incorrect order of operations: dereference ignored
00642     #pragma warning (disable:    6285)           // (<non-zero constant>) || (<non-zero constant>) is always a non-zero constant. Did you intend to use bitwize-and operator?
00643     #pragma warning (disable:    6319)           // Use of the comma-operator in a tested expression causes the left argument to be ignored when it has no side-effects
00644     #pragma warning (disable:    6326)           // Potential comparison of a constant with another constant
00645     #pragma warning (disable:   26135)           // Missing locking annotation
00646     #pragma warning (disable:   26400)           // Do not assign the result of an allocation or a function call with an owner<T> return value to a raw pointer, use owner<T> instead (i.11).
00647     #pragma warning (disable:   26401)           // Do not delete a raw pointer that is not an owner<T> (i.11).
00648     #pragma warning (disable:   26403)           // Reset or explicitly delete an owner<T> pointer 'name' (r.3).
00649     #pragma warning (disable:   26408)           // Avoid malloc() and free(), prefer the nothrow version of new with delete (r.10).
00650     #pragma warning (disable:   26409)           // Avoid calling new and delete explicitly, use std::make_unique<T> instead (r.11).
00651     #pragma warning (disable:   26426)           // Global initializer calls a non-constexpr function 'name' (i.22).
00652     #pragma warning (disable:   26429)           // Symbol 'name' is never tested for nullness, it can be marked as not_null (f.23).
00653     #pragma warning (disable:   26430)           // Symbol 'name' is not tested for nullness on all paths (f.23).
00654     #pragma warning (disable:   26432)           // If you define or delete any default operation in the type 'struct 'name'', define or delete them all (c.21).
00655     #pragma warning (disable:   26435)           // Function 'name' should specify exactly one of 'virtual', 'override', or 'final' (c.128).
00656     #pragma warning (disable:   26438)           // Avoid 'goto' (es.76).
00657     #pragma warning (disable:   26440)           // Function 'name' can be declared 'noexcept' (f.6).
00658     #pragma warning (disable:   26446)           // Prefer to use gsl::at() instead of unchecked subscript operator (bounds.4).
00659     #pragma warning (disable:   26447)           // The function is declared 'noexcept' but calls function 'func' which may throw exceptions (f.6).
00660     #pragma warning (disable:   26448)           // Consider using gsl::finally if final action is intended (gsl.util).
00661     #pragma warning (disable:   26451)           // Arithmetic overflow: Using operator 'op' on a n-byte value and then casting the result to a m-byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'op' to avoid overflow (io.2).
00662     #pragma warning (disable:   26455)           // Default constructor may not throw. Declare it 'noexcept' (f.6).
00663     #pragma warning (disable:   26460)           // The reference argument 'stream' for function 'name' can be marked as const (con.3).
00664     #pragma warning (disable:   26461)           // The pointer argument 'name' for function 'name' can be marked as a pointer to const (con.3).
00665     #pragma warning (disable:   26462)           // The value pointed to by 'name' is assigned only once, mark it as a pointer to const (con.4).
00666     #pragma warning (disable:   26475)           // Do not use function style C-casts (es.49).
00667     #pragma warning (disable:   26477)           // Use 'nullptr' rather than 0 or NULL (es.47).
00668     #pragma warning (disable:   26481)           // Don't use pointer arithmetic. Use span instead (bounds.1).
00669     #pragma warning (disable:   26482)           // Only index into arrays using constant expressions (bounds.2).
00670     #pragma warning (disable:   26483)           // Value 'value' is outside the bounds (min, max) of variable 'name'. Only index into arrays using constant expressions that are within bounds of the array (bounds.2).
00671     #pragma warning (disable:   26485)           // Expression 'expr': No array to pointer decay (bounds.3).
00672     #pragma warning (disable:   26486)           // Don't pass a pointer that may be invalid to a function. Parameter 'n' 'name' in call to 'name' may be invalid (lifetime.3).
00673     #pragma warning (disable:   26487)           // Don't return a pointer 'name' that may be invalid (lifetime.4).
00674     #pragma warning (disable:   26488)           // Do not dereference a potentially null pointer: 'name'. 'name' was null at line 'n' (lifetime.1).
00675     #pragma warning (disable:   26489)           // Don't dereference a pointer that may be invalid: 'name'. 'name' may have been invalidated at line 'n' (lifetime.1).
00676     #pragma warning (disable:   26490)           // Don't use reinterpret_cast (type.1).
00677     #pragma warning (disable:   26492)           // Don't use const_cast to cast away const or volatile (type.3).
00678     #pragma warning (disable:   26493)           // Don't use C-style casts (type.4).
00679     #pragma warning (disable:   26496)           // The variable 'name' is assigned only once, mark it as const (con.4).
00680     #pragma warning (disable:   26497)           // The function 'name' could be marked constexpr if compile-time evaluation is desired (f.4).
00681     #pragma warning (disable:   26812)           // The enum type 'type' is unscoped. Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' (Enum.3).
00682     #pragma warning (disable:   26814)           // The const variable 'name' can be computed at compile-time. Consider using constexpr (con.5).
00683     #pragma warning (disable:   28125)           // The function must be called from within a try/except block
00684     #pragma warning (disable:   28159)           // Consider using another function instead
00685 
00686     #pragma warning (default:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
00687 
00688     #define _tx_thread          __declspec (thread)
00689     #define _tx_decltype(value)   decltype (value)
00690 
00691     #if !defined (_CLANG_VER)
00692 
00693     #pragma setlocale           ("russian")      // Set source file encoding, see also _TX_CODEPAGE
00694 
00695     #if !defined (NDEBUG)
00696         #pragma check_stack     (      on)       // Turn on stack probes at runtime
00697         #pragma strict_gs_check (push, on)       // Detects stack buffer overruns
00698     #endif
00699 
00700     #endif
00701 
00702     #define _CRT_SECURE_CPP_OVERLOAD_SECURE_NAMES  1
00703 
00704 #endif
00705

00707 
00708 #if  defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
00709 
00710     #pragma warning (disable:    174)            // Remark: expression has no effect
00711     #pragma warning (disable:    304)            // Remark: access control not specified ("public" by default)
00712     #pragma warning (disable:    444)            // Remark: destructor for base class "..." is not virtual
00713     #pragma warning (disable:    522)            // Remark: function "..." redeclared "inline" after being called
00714     #pragma warning (disable:    981)            // Remark: operands are evaluated in unspecified order
00715     #pragma warning (disable:   1684)            // Conversion from pointer to same-sized integral type (potential portability problem)
00716 
00717 #endif

00723 
00724     #ifdef __GNUC__
00725     #error

00746     #error

00748     #error nesessary for txSpeak() to work.

00760 #endif                                           //   they are allowed by default if WINVER >= 0x0600.

00771 #define stristrw( str1, str2 )         Win32::StrStrIW ((str1), (str2))

00776 #define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS           1         // PRIu64 and other PR... macros
00777 #define __STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__         1         // String and output *_s functions
00778 
00779 #define _LIBCPP_ENABLE_CXX17_REMOVED_UNEXPECTED_FUNCTIONS  // Wow, how long. Kudos, Clang
00780 
00781 #define _ALLOW_RTCc_IN_STL             1         // MSVC C2338: /RTCc rejects conformant code, so it isn't supported by libc.
00782 
00783 #define NOMINMAX                       1         // Preventing 'min' and 'max' defines in Windows.h
00784 
00785 #if defined (_DEBUG)

00787 #define _HAS_ITERATOR_DEBUGGING        1
00788 #define _LIBCPP_DEBUG                  1
00789 #endif

00795     #define NEW                        new (_NORMAL_BLOCK, __FILE__, __LINE__)

00887 #endif
00888 
00889 #if !defined (_TRUNCATE) || defined (__CYGWIN__) || defined (_MEMORY_S_DEFINED)
00890 
00891     #define  strncpy_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count )  ( strncpy ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
00892     #define  wcsncpy_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count )  ( wcsncpy ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
00893     #define  strncat_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count )  ( strncat ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
00894     #define  strerror_s( buf, sizeof_buf, code        )  ( strncpy ((buf), strerror ((int)(code)), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
00895     #define  strtok_s(   buf, delim, ctx              )  ( (void)(ctx), strtok ((buf), (delim)) )
00896     #define  fopen_s(    file, name, mode             )  ( *(file) = fopen ((name), (mode)) )
00897     #define _strlwr_s(   str, sizeof_str              )  ( _strlwr (str) )
00898 
00899     #define  ctime_s( buf, sizeof_buf, time    )         ( strncpy ((buf), ctime (time), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
00900     #define _controlfp_s( oldCtl, newCtl, mask )         ( assert (oldCtl), *(oldCtl) = _controlfp (newCtl, mask), 0 )
00901 
00902     #define _snprintf_s                                  snprintf
00903     #define _vsnprintf_s( str, sz, trunc, format, arg )  _vsnprintf (str, sz, format, arg)
00904 
00905 #endif
00906 
00907 #if !( defined (_MSC_VER) || defined (__STDC_LIB_EXT1__) )
00908 
00909     #define  getenv_s( sz, buf, sizeof_buf, name )       ( (void)(sz), strncpy ((buf), getenv (name), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
00910 
00911 #endif
00912 
00913 #if defined (__CYGWIN__)
00914 
00915     #undef   __STRICT_ANSI__
00916 
00917     typedef  void                                _exception;
00918 
00919     #define _O_TEXT                              O_TEXT
00920     #define _fdopen                              fdopen
00921     #define _flushall()                          fflush (NULL)
00922     #define _getcwd                              getcwd
00923     #define _getpid                              getpid
00924     #define _stricmp                             strcasecmp
00925     #define _strlwr                              strlwr
00926     #define _strnicmp                            strncasecmp
00927     #define _unlink                              unlink

00939      defined (_GCC_VER) && (_GCC_VER == 492) && !defined (_WIN64) // Dev-CPP 5.11: TDM-GCC 4.9.2 MinGW64 with -m32

01367 
01368 const COLORREF
01369 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
01370     enum txColors {
01371 #endif
01372 
01373     TX_BLACK         = RGB (  0,   0,   0),   
01374     TX_BLUE          = RGB (  0,   0, 128),   
01375     TX_GREEN         = RGB (  0, 128,   0),   
01376     TX_CYAN          = RGB (  0, 128, 128),   
01377     TX_RED           = RGB (128,   0,   0),   
01378     TX_MAGENTA       = RGB (128,   0, 128),   
01379     TX_BROWN         = RGB (128, 128,   0),   
01380     TX_ORANGE        = RGB (255, 128,   0),   
01381     TX_GRAY          = RGB (160, 160, 160),   
01382     TX_DARKGRAY      = RGB (128, 128, 128),   
01383     TX_LIGHTGRAY     = RGB (192, 192, 192),   
01384     TX_LIGHTBLUE     = RGB (  0,   0, 255),   
01385     TX_LIGHTGREEN    = RGB (  0, 255, 128),   
01386     TX_LIGHTCYAN     = RGB (  0, 255, 255),   
01387     TX_LIGHTRED      = RGB (255,   0, 128),   
01388     TX_LIGHTMAGENTA  = RGB (255,   0, 255),   
01389     TX_PINK          = RGB (255, 128, 255),   
01390     TX_YELLOW        = RGB (255, 255, 128),   
01391     TX_WHITE         = RGB (255, 255, 255),   
01392     TX_TRANSPARENT   = 0xFFFFFFFF,            
01393     TX_NULL          = TX_TRANSPARENT,        
01394 
01395 //  Цветовые каналы (компоненты) -- см. txExtractColor(), txRGB2HSL(), txHSL2RGB()
01396 
01397     TX_HUE          = 0x04000000,             
01398     TX_SATURATION   = 0x05000000,             
01399     TX_LIGHTNESS    = 0x06000000;             
01400 
01401 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
01402     };
01403 #endif
01404 
01406 #define TX_GREY       TX_GRAY
01407 #define TX_DARKGREY   TX_DARKGRAY
01408 #define TX_LIGHTGREY  TX_LIGHTGRAY
01409

01440 #endif

01981 
01982 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02000 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02001 
02002 inline bool txTriangle (double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
02003     {
02004     (void)x1; (void)y1; (void)x2; (void)y2; (void)x3; (void)y3;
02005 
02006     MessageBox (txWindow(),
02007                "txTriangle (double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)\n\n"
02008                "Эта функция не реализована в библиотеке, потому что вы легко можете реализовать ее сами "
02009                "как функцию с параметрами, используя txPolygon(). См. \"Пример с функциями с параметрами\". "
02010                "Ну или нарисовать тремя линиями. :)",
02011                "TXLib сообщает", MB_ICONINFORMATION);
02012 
02013     return false;
02014     }
02015 
02016 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02018 
02019 bool txNotifyIcon (unsigned flags, const char title[], const char format[], ...) tx_printfy (3);
02020 
02021 #define txRectandle  Sleep (1000), txRectangle  // Copy-protection for the function below
02022 #define txLine(...)  txLine (__VA_ARGS__); {    //
02023 #define txNotifyIcon }}}}}}}}}} txNotifyIcon    // Не спрашивайте, зачем. Это дичь.
02024 #define txCircle     ;txCircle                  //
02025 #define txSetColor   ;txSetColor                //
02026 #define C0L0RREF     COLORREF                   //
02027 #define OxFFFFFF     0xFFFFFF                   //
02028 #define lO           10                         //
02029 #define lOOO         1000                       //
02030 #define O                                       //
02031 
02033 //}
02034 
02035 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02076 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//////
02077                                                                                                                        //
02078 inline void txDrawMan (int x, int y, int sizeX, int sizeY, COLORREF color, double handL, double handR, double twist,   //
02079                        double head, double eyes, double wink, double crazy, double smile, double hair, double wind)    //
02080     {                                                                                                                  //
02081     const char msg[] = "\0/А я - человечек из библиотеки!\0/Меня объясняли на уроке!\0/Напиши меня сам!\0/";           //
02082     //                   |                                |                          |                  |              //
02083     // Не копипастите! _/ \_ Все равно не получится! :) _/ \_  Человечки защищают  _/ \_ этот код! :) _/ \_  Муаххаха! //
02084     //                                                                                                                 //
02085     static int count = GetTickCount(), L = 0;  
02086 
02087     C0L0RREF lineColor = txGetColor();
02088     C0L0RREF fillColor = txGetFillColor();
02089 
02090     txSetColor     (color, 3);
02091     txSetFillColor (color);
02092 
02093     txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x, y - O.7 * sizeY);
02094 
02095     txLine (x, y - O.7 * sizeY, x - sizeX/2, y - (O.7 + handL) * sizeY);
02096     txLine (x, y - O.7 * sizeY, x + sizeX/2, y - (O.7 + handR) * sizeY);
02097 
02098     txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x - sizeX/2, y);
02099     txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x + sizeX/2, y);
02100 
02101     txCircle (x, y - (O.85 + head) * sizeY, O.15 * sizeY);
02102 
02103     txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x +  wind/lO        * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
02104     txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + (wind/lO - O.1) * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
02105     txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + (wind/lO + O.1) * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
02106 
02107     txSetColor     (~color & OxFFFFFF);  // Inverse the color
02108     txSetFillColor (~color & OxFFFFFF);
02109 
02110     txLine (x, y - (O.8 + head - O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY, x - O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.8 + head + O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY);
02111     txLine (x, y - (O.8 + head - O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY, x + O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.8 + head + O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY);
02112 
02113     txNotifyIcon (4, (const char*)!! (L+'L')[msg], "\n%s\n", msg + ((unsigned) (((count -=- 1) ^=! 1) ^=~ ((0)^(0)) +1) % 3)["\"<"]);
02114 
02115     // See above: Mouth operator -=-, Cat operator ^=!, Mouse operator ^=~ and Owl constant ((0)^(0)). Use it freely, meow
02116 
02117     txCircle (x - O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.9 + head - O.02 * crazy) * sizeY, eyes * (1 + O.5*wink) * O.02 * sizeY);
02118     txCircle (x + O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.9 + head + O.02 * crazy) * sizeY, eyes * (1 - O.5*wink) * O.02 * sizeY);
02119     Sleep (lOOO + count%2);
02120 
02121     txSetColor     ((color == 0xDEADFACE)? TX_DARKGRAY : TX_TRANSPARENT);
02122     txSetFillColor (TX_TRANSPARENT);
02123 
02124     txCircle (x, y, 4);
02125     txRectandle (x - sizeX/2, y - sizeY, x + sizeX/2, y);
02126 
02127     txSetColor     (lineColor);
02128     txSetFillColor (fillColor);
02129     }
02130 
02132 //}
02133 //=================================================================================================================

04100 int txPrintf (const char* format, ArgsT... args);
04101

04103

04109 
04110 enum width_t     : int {};
04111 enum precision_t : int {};
04112 
04113 inline width_t     width     (int width) { return (width_t)     width; }
04114 inline precision_t precision (int prec)  { return (precision_t) prec;  }
04115 
04116 #endif

04199 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04271 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04273 
04274 #define sizearr( arr )  ( sizeof (get_size_of_an_array_with_unknown_or_nonconst_size_ (arr)) )
04275 
04277 //  See explanation here: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/the1/archive/2004/05/07/128242.aspx
04278 
04279 template <typename T, size_t N> char (&get_size_of_an_array_with_unknown_or_nonconst_size_ (T (&) [N])) [N];  // ;=P
04280 
04281 //  Another approach
04282 
04283 #if defined (_TX_CPP11_MSVC15)
04284 template <typename T, size_t N> constexpr size_t countof (const T (&) [N] ) { return N; }
04285 #endif
04286 
04288 
04289 #define SIZEARR( arr )  ( sizeof (arr) / sizeof ((arr)[0]) )
04290

04450 #define MAX( a, b )     ( ((a) > (b))? (a) : (b) )
04451

04471 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04472 
04473 #define MIN( a, b )     ( ((a) < (b))? (a) : (b) )
04474 
04475 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04489 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04490 
04491 #if defined (__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L  // MSVC: C99 case
04492 
04493     #define ROUND( x )  ( (long) round (x) )
04494 
04495 #else
04496 
04497     #define ROUND( x )  ( (long) floor ((x) + 0.5) )
04498 
04499 #endif
04500 
04501 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04520 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04521 
04522 void tx_fpreset();
04523 
04524 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04533 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04534 
04535 const double txPI = asin (1.0) * 2;
04536 
04537 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04564 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04565 
04566 inline double txSqr (double x)
04567     {
04568     double sqr = pow (sqrt (x) * sqrt (x), sqrt (4.0));  // Бурная вычислительная деятельность
04569 
04570     char str[1024] = "";
04571     _snprintf_s (str, sizeof (str), "Возведение дало %g!" "!!" "!!" " Вы рады????", sqr);
04572     txMessageBox (str, "Получен ОТВЕТ!" "!!", MB_ICONEXCLAMATION | MB_YESNO) != IDNO ||
04573         (
04574         txMessageBox ("Жаль...", "А я так старалась", MB_ICONINFORMATION),
04575         txMessageBox ("Уйду я от вас", "Злые вы...",  MB_ICONSTOP),
04576         exit (EXIT_FAILURE), 0
04577         );
04578 
04579     txNotifyIcon (1, NULL, "\n%s\n", "Высшая математика!  \0"  // А как это работает, а?
04580                                      "С ума сойти...      \0"  //
04581                                      "а КЭП подтверждает  \0"  //       и кто это будет
04582                                      "Главное - отчитаться\0"  //       поддерживать?..
04583                                      "Невероятно, но факт \0"
04584                                      "Кто бы мог подумать?\0" + GetTickCount() % 6 * 21);
04585 
04586     return sqr;  // Все же вернем значение. Мы же не звери
04587     }
04588 
04589 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04611 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04612 
04613 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
04614 #define _TX_DESTROY_3D
04615 #endif
04616 
04617 #if defined (_TX_DESTROY_3D)
04618 
04619     #define z  0                   // Читайте "Флатландию" Эбботта!
04620 
04621 #endif
04622 
04623 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04640 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04642 
04643 #define please
04644 
04645 #define meow   ;
04646 
04647 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && !defined (_CLANG_VER)
04648 #define мяу    meow
04649 #endif
04650 
04652 
04653 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04671 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04672 
04673 #define ZERO( type )    zero <type> ()
04674 
04676 template <typename T> inline T zero() tx_nodiscard;
04678 
04679 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04706 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04708 
04709 #define  tx_auto_func(    func )  _tx_auto_fun1 ( __LINE__, func )
04710 #define _tx_auto_fun1( n, func )  _tx_auto_fun2 ( n,        func )
04711 #define _tx_auto_fun2( n, func )  auto _tx_auto_func_##n = _tx_auto_func ([&]() { func; })
04712 
04713 #define tx_finally(...)           tx_auto_func (__VA_ARGS__)
04714 
04715 template <typename T>
04716 struct _tx_auto_func_
04717     {
04718     typedef _tx_auto_func_<T> this_t;
04719     T func_;
04720 
04721     explicit _tx_auto_func_ (T func) : func_ (func) {}
04722             ~_tx_auto_func_ ()       { func_ ();     }
04723 
04724     private:         _tx_auto_func_ ()              _tx_delete;
04725                      _tx_auto_func_ (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
04726              this_t& operator =     (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
04727     };
04728 
04729 template <typename T>
04730 _tx_auto_func_<T> _tx_auto_func  (T   func)
04731     {
04732     return        _tx_auto_func_ <T> (func);
04733     }
04734 
04736 
04737 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04782 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04783 
04784 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04785     #undef  TX_ASSERT
04786     #define TX_ASSERT( cond ) _txNOP ( !(cond)? (TX_ERROR ("\a" "ВНЕЗАПНО: Логическая ошибка: " \
04787                                                            "Неверно, что \"%s\"." TX_COMMA #cond), 1/(int)!!(cond)) : 1 )
04788 #else
04789     #undef  TX_ASSERT
04790     #define TX_ASSERT( cond ) ((void) 1)
04791 
04792 #endif
04793 
04794 #ifdef assert
04795     #undef assert
04796 #endif
04797 
04798 #define assert( cond )        TX_ASSERT (cond)
04799 
04800 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04827 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04828 
04829 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04830     #define asserted          || TX_ERROR ("\a" "Обнаружен нулевой или ложный результат.")
04831 
04832 #else
04833     #define asserted          || _txNOP (0)
04834 
04835 #endif
04836 
04837 #define verified              asserted  //!< For compatibility with assert macro
04838 
04840 #define TX_NEEDED             asserted  //!< For compatibility with earlier releases
04841 
04842 
04843 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04871 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04872 
04873 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04874     #undef  verify
04875     #define verify            assert
04876 
04877 #else
04878     #undef  verify
04879     #define verify( expr )    ( expr )
04880 
04881 #endif
04882 
04883 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04902 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04903 
04904 #if !defined (FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY)
04905     #define TX_ERROR( ... )   _txError (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, 0, ##__VA_ARGS__)
04906 #else
04907     #define TX_ERROR( msg )   _txError (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, 0, msg)
04908 #endif
04909 
04911     #define TX_THROW          TX_ERROR  //!< For compatibility with earlier TXLib releases
04912 
04913 
04914 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04930 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04931 
04932 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04933     #define TX_DEBUG_ERROR(...)  TX_ERROR (__VA_ARGS__)
04934 
04935 #else
04936     #define TX_DEBUG_ERROR(...)  ((void) 0)
04937 
04938 #endif
04939 
04940 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04960 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04961 
04962 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
04963 void txDump (const void* address, const char name[] = "_txDump()", bool pause = true);
04964 #endif
04965 
04967 
04968 #ifdef _MSC_VER
04969 #define txDump( ... )           _txDump ((const void*)(uintptr_t) __VA_ARGS__)
04970 #else
04971 #define txDump( address, ... )  _txDump ((const void*)(uintptr_t) (address), #address, ##__VA_ARGS__)
04972 #endif
04973 
04974 void _txDump (const void* address, const char name[] = "_txDump()", bool pause = true);
04975 
04977 
04978 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05004 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05005 
05006 #define txStackBackTrace()    _txStackBackTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, true);
05007 
05008 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05030 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05032 
05033 std::string txDemangle (const char* mangledName);
05034 char*       txDemangle (const char* mangledName, std::nomeow_t);
05035 
05036 #define txTypename(value)     txDemangle (typeid (value) .name()) .c_str()
05037 
05039 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05066 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05067 
05068 int txRegQuery (const char* keyName, const char* valueName, void* value, size_t szValue);
05069 
05070 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05083 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05085 
05086 #define _                     ,
05087 #define TX_COMMA              ,  //!< Синоним макроса _ (@ref _ "символ подчеркивания")
05088 
05090 
05092 //}

05209

05211 
05212 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05223 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05225 
05226 bool txUnlock();
05227 
05229 template <typename T> inline T txUnlock (T value);
05231 
05233 
05234 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05257 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05258 
05259 #define txGDI( command, dc )  ( ((dc) == txDC())? txUnlock ( (txLock(), (command)) ) : (command) )
05260

05284 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

05294 #endif

05740 //=================================================================================================================
05741 
05742 //=================================================================================================================
05743 //{          Internal diagnostics
05745 //=================================================================================================================
05747 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05787 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05788 
05789 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05790 #define _TX_ALLOW_TRACE
05791 #endif
05792 
05793 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05823 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05824 
05825 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05826 #define       TX_TRACE
05827 #endif
05828 
05829 #if !defined (TX_TRACE)
05830     #define   TX_TRACE  { if (_txLoc::Cur.trace) _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__); }
05831 #endif
05832 
05834 void _txTrace (const char file[], int line, const char func[], const char msg[] = NULL, ...);
05836 
05837 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05840 
05841 #ifndef   FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05842 
05843 struct _txLoc
05844     {
05845     const char*   func;
05846     const char*   file;
05847     int           line;
05848 
05849     int           inTX;   // We are inside one of TXLib functions
05850     int           trace;  // Internal TX trace level, when enabled by _TX_ALLOW_TRACE
05851 
05852     const _txLoc* prev;   // Caller's location
05853 
05854     static _txLoc _tx_thread Cur;
05855     };
05856 
05857 struct _txFuncEntry
05858     {
05859     typedef _txFuncEntry this_t;
05860 
05861     _txLoc loc;
05862 
05863     _txFuncEntry() : loc (_txLoc::Cur) { _txLoc::Cur.inTX++; _txLoc::Cur.prev = &loc; }
05864     void restore()                     { _txLoc::Cur = loc;                           }
05865    ~_txFuncEntry()                     { restore();                                   }
05866 
05867     private:
05868             _txFuncEntry (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
05869     this_t& operator =   (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
05870     };
05871 
05872 #if defined (_GCC_VER)
05873 
05874     inline void __txLocCurSet (const char* _file, int _line, const char* _func)
05875         { _txLoc::Cur.file = _file; _txLoc::Cur.line = _line; _txLoc::Cur.func = _func; }
05876 
05877 #else
05878 
05879     #define __txLocCurSet( _file, _line, _func ) \
05880         ( _txLoc::Cur.file = (_file), _txLoc::Cur.line = (_line), _txLoc::Cur.func = (_func) )
05881 
05882 #endif
05883 
05884 #define _txLocCurSet()     __txLocCurSet (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__)
05885 
05886 #define _txLocLvlSet(lvl)  { _txLoc::Cur.trace = (lvl); }
05887 
05888 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05889 
05890 #if defined ($0)
05891     #undef   $0
05892     #endif
05893 
05894 #if defined ($1)
05895     #undef   $1
05896     #endif
05897 
05898 #if defined ($2)
05899     #undef   $2
05900     #endif
05901 
05902 #if defined ($3)
05903     #undef   $3
05904     #endif
05905 
05906 #if defined ($4)
05907     #undef   $4
05908     #endif
05909 
05910 #if defined ($5)
05911     #undef   $5
05912     #endif
05913 
05914 #if defined ($6)
05915     #undef   $6
05916     #endif
05917 
05918 #if defined ($7)
05919     #undef   $7
05920     #endif
05921 
05922 #if defined ($8)
05923     #undef   $8
05924     #endif
05925 
05926 #if defined ($9)
05927     #undef   $9
05928     #endif
05929 
05930 #if defined ($)
05931     #undef   $
05932     #endif
05933 
05934 #if defined ($$)
05935     #undef   $$
05936     #endif
05937 
05938 //}
05939 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05940 
05941 #if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
05942 
05943     #define _txEntry(lvl)  _txFuncEntry __txFuncEntry; { if (lvl) _txLocLvlSet (lvl);    $;          }
05944 
05945     #define  $           { _txLocCurSet(); if (_txLoc::Cur.trace <= _TX_ALLOW_TRACE+0) { TX_TRACE; } }
05946 
05947     #define  $$          { __txFuncEntry.restore();                                                  }
05948 
05949 #elif defined (_DEBUG)
05950 
05951     #define _txEntry(lvl)  _txFuncEntry __txFuncEntry; {                                 $;          }
05952 
05953     #define  $           { _txLocCurSet();                                                           }
05954 
05955     #define  $$          { __txFuncEntry.restore();                                                  }
05956 
05957 #else
05958 
05959     #define _txEntry(lvl)  ;
05960     #define  $             ;
05961     #define  $$            ;
05962 
05963 #endif
05964 
05965 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05966 
05967 #define      $0            _txEntry (0)  // (Log level unchanged)
05968 #define      $1            _txEntry (1)  // Regular functions
05969 #define      $2            _txEntry (2)  // Resvd
05970 #define      $3            _txEntry (3)  // Init/Cleanup
05971 #define      $4            _txEntry (4)  // Init/Cleanup, misc functions
05972 #define      $5            _txEntry (5)  // Error handling, entry points
05973 #define      $6            _txEntry (6)  // Error handling, main part
05974 #define      $7            _txEntry (7)  // Error handling, misc functions
05975 #define      $8            _txEntry (8)  // Canvas worker thread
05976 #define      $9            _txEntry (9)  // Resvd
05977 
05978 //}
05979 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05980 
05981 #endif // FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05982 
05985 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05986 
05988 //}
05989 //=================================================================================================================
05990 
05991 //=================================================================================================================
05992 //{          Sweet critical section blocking: txAutoLock class
05993 //=================================================================================================================
05994 
05995 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06011 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06012 
06014 extern CRITICAL_SECTION _txCanvas_LockBackBuf;
06016 
06017 class txAutoLock
06018     {
06019     typedef txAutoLock this_t;
06020 
06021     public:
06022 
06023 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06046 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06047 
06048     explicit txAutoLock (CRITICAL_SECTION* cs, bool mandatory = true) :
06049         cs_ (cs)
06050         {
06051 $1      if (!cs_) return;
06052 
06053         if (mandatory) {$    EnterCriticalSection (cs_);                   }
06054         else           {$ TryEnterCriticalSection (cs_)? 0 : (cs_ = NULL); }
06055         }
06056 
06057 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06070 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06071 
06072     explicit txAutoLock (bool mandatory = true) :
06073         cs_ (NULL)
06074         {
06075 $1      new (this) txAutoLock (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf, mandatory);
06076         }
06077 
06078 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06080 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06081 
06082    ~txAutoLock()
06083         {
06084 $1      if (!cs_) return;
06085 $       LeaveCriticalSection (cs_); cs_ = NULL;
06086         }
06087 
06088 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06091 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06092 
06093     operator bool () const
06094         {
06095 $1      return (cs_ != NULL);
06096         }
06097 
06098 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06100 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06101 
06102 //  private:
06103     CRITICAL_SECTION* cs_;
06104 
06105 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06107 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06109 
06110     private:
06111             txAutoLock (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06112     this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06113 
06115 
06116     };
06117 
06118 //}
06119 //=================================================================================================================
06120 
06121 //=================================================================================================================
06122 //{          Dialogs: txDialog class
06124 //=================================================================================================================
06126 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06147 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06148 
06149 struct txDialog
06150     {
06151     typedef txDialog this_t;
06152 
06153 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06166 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06167 
06168     public:
06169     enum CONTROL
06170         {
06171         DIALOG    = (int) 0x00000000,            
06172         BUTTON    = (int) 0xFFFF0080,            
06173         EDIT      = (int) 0xFFFF0081,            
06174         STATIC    = (int) 0xFFFF0082,            
06175         LISTBOX   = (int) 0xFFFF0083,            
06176         SCROLLBAR = (int) 0xFFFF0084,            
06177         COMBOBOX  = (int) 0xFFFF0085,            
06178         END       = (int) 0x00000000             
06179         };
06180 
06181 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06198 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06199 
06200     public:
06201     struct Layout
06202         {
06203         CONTROL     wndclass;                    
06204         const char* caption;                     
06205         WORD        id;                          
06206         short        x;                          
06207         short        y;                          
06208         short       sx;                          
06209         short       sy;                          
06210         DWORD       style;                       
06211 
06212         const char* font;                        
06213         WORD        fontsize;                    
06214         };
06215 
06216 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06224 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06225 
06226     public:
06227     txDialog();
06228 
06229 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06239 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06240 
06241     explicit txDialog (const Layout* layout);
06242 
06243 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06245 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06246 
06247     virtual ~txDialog() {};
06248 
06249 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06261 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06262 
06263     const Layout* setLayout (const Layout *layout);
06264 
06265 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06283 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06284 
06285     virtual int dialogProc (HWND _wnd, UINT _msg, WPARAM _wParam, LPARAM _lParam);
06286 
06287 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06303 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06304 
06305     intptr_t dialogBox (const Layout* layout = NULL, size_t bufsize = 0);
06306 
06307 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06320 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06321 
06322     intptr_t dialogBox (WORD resource);
06323 
06324 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06326 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06327 
06328     private:
06329             txDialog   (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06330     this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06331 
06332 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06334 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06335 
06336     protected:
06337     static intptr_t CALLBACK DialogProc_ (HWND wnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam);
06338 
06339 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06341 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06342 
06343     private:
06344     const Layout* layout_;
06345     };
06346 
06348 //}
06349 //=================================================================================================================
06350 
06351 //=================================================================================================================
06352 //{          Dialogs: Message Map macros
06354 //=================================================================================================================
06356 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06377 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06378 
06379 #define TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP()                                                                 \
06380     virtual int dialogProc (HWND _wnd, UINT _msg, WPARAM _wParam, LPARAM _lParam) _tx_override \
06381         {                                                                                      \
06382         int _result = txDialog::dialogProc (_wnd, _msg, _wParam, _lParam); (void) _result;     \
06383                                                                                                \
06384         switch (_msg)                                                                          \
06385             {                                                                                  \
06386             case WM_NULL:
06387 
06388 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06407 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06408 
06409 #define TX_HANDLE( id )                                                                        \
06410             break;                                                                             \
06411             case (id):
06412 
06413 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06433 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06434 
06435 #define TX_COMMAND_MAP                                                                         \
06436             default: break;                                                                    \
06437             }                                                                                  \
06438                                                                                                \
06439         if (_msg == WM_COMMAND) switch (LOWORD (_wParam))                                      \
06440             {                                                                                  \
06441             case 0:
06442 
06443 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06462 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06463 
06464 #define TX_END_MESSAGE_MAP                                                                     \
06465             default: break;                                                                    \
06466             }                                                                                  \
06467                                                                                                \
06468         return FALSE;                                                                          \
06469         }
06470 
06472 //}
06473 //=================================================================================================================
06474 
06475 //=================================================================================================================
06476 //{          Dialogs: txDialog example: txInputBox()
06478 //=================================================================================================================
06480 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06500 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06501 
06502 const char* txInputBox (const char* text = NULL, const char* caption = NULL, const char* input = NULL) tx_nodiscard;
06503 
06504 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
06505 
06506 const char* txInputBox (const char* text, const char* caption, const char* input)
06507     {
06508     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06509     // Если не указаны параметры, приходится использовать хоть какие-то надписи.
06510     // txGetModuleFileName() -- имя EXE-файла, на случай, если кое-кто поленился задать название.
06511     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06512 
06513     if (!text)    text    = "Введите строку:";
06514     if (!caption) caption = txGetModuleFileName (false);
06515     if (!input)   input   = "";
06516 
06517     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06518     // Идентификаторы элементов диалога. Они требуются в GetDlgItemText().
06519     // Если диалог строится не вручную, а редактором ресурсов, то они задаются в нем автоматически.
06520     // У нас же тут -- хардкор стайл, к сожалению. Причина в том, что у разных сред программирования разные редакторы
06521     // ресурсов и системы сборки. Поэтому для независимости от них все будет строиться на этапе выполнения,
06522     // динамически. Вы еще гляньте, как это реализовано в txDialog::dialogBox() и функциях _tx_DLGTEMPLATE_()... О_о
06523     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06524 
06525     #define ID_TEXT_  101
06526     #define ID_INPUT_ 102
06527 
06528     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06529     // Задание макета (вида) диалога в виде массива структур.
06530     // С помощью особого порядка полей в структуре txDialog::Layout и констант из класса txDialog этот массив
06531     // становится похож на описание ресурса диалога в .rc-файле.
06532     // См. описание синтаксиса rc-файла в документации по Win32 (MSDN, http://msdn.com).
06533     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06534 
06535     txDialog::Layout layout[] =
06536 
06537     //----------------------+----------+-----------+-----------------+---------------------------------------------
06538     //     Тип элемента     | Имя      | Иденти-   |   Координаты    | Флаги элементов
06539     //     диалога          | элемента | фикатор   |-----------------| (см. описание элементов
06540     //                      |          | элемента  | X | Y |Шир.|Выс.| окон диалога в MSDN)
06541     //----------------------+----------+-----------+---+---+----+----+---------------------------------------------
06542     //                      |          |           |   |   |    |    |
06543         {{ txDialog::DIALOG,  caption,   0,           0,  0, 240,  85                                                    },
06544          { txDialog::STATIC,  text,      ID_TEXT_,   10, 10, 150,  40, SS_LEFT                                           },
06545          { txDialog::EDIT,    input,     ID_INPUT_,  10, 60, 220,  15, ES_LEFT | WS_BORDER | ES_AUTOHSCROLL | WS_TABSTOP },
06546          { txDialog::BUTTON,  "&OK",     IDOK,      180, 10,  50,  15, BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON                     | WS_TABSTOP },
06547          { txDialog::BUTTON,  "&Cancel", IDCANCEL,  180, 30,  50,  15, BS_PUSHBUTTON                        | WS_TABSTOP },
06548          { txDialog::END                                                                                                 }};
06549 
06550     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06551     // Класс диалога для InputBox. Внутренний, т.к. зачем ему быть внешним.
06552     // Нужен в основном для задания строки ввода (str) и оконной функции диалогового окна, требуемой Win32 (она
06553     // построена макросами TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP и другими). Можно не делать внутреннего класса, но тогда оконную
06554     // функцию придется писать в глобальной области видимости, и str объявлять глобально тоже (или передавать ее
06555     // адрес через DialogBoxParam и записывать его в класс во время обработки WM_INITDIALOG).
06556     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06557     struct inputDlg : txDialog
06558         {
06559         char str [1024];
06560 
06561         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06562 
06563         inputDlg() :
06564             str()
06565             {}
06566 
06567         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06568 
06569         TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP()    // Карта сообщений (на самом деле это начало оконной функции).
06570 
06571             TX_COMMAND_MAP        // Здесь обрабатываются WM_COMMAND (на самом деле это оператор switch).
06572 
06573                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06574                 // При нажатии кнопки OK копируем строку из поля ввода в нашу переменную str, т.к. после закрытия
06575                 // диалога строка ввода умрет и текст уже из нее получить.
06576                 // Этот макрос на самом деле превращается в case из оператора switch.
06577                 // _wnd -- это параметр оконной функции, см. определение макроса TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP().
06578                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06579 
06580                 TX_HANDLE (IDOK) GetDlgItemText (_wnd, ID_INPUT_, str, sizeof (str) - 1);
06581 
06582         TX_END_MESSAGE_MAP
06583 
06584         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06585         // Конец внутреннего класса диалога
06586         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06587         };
06588 
06589     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06590     // Убираем дефайны, чтобы потом не мешали.
06591     // От этого они получаются "локального действия", как будто у них была бы область видимости -- функция. На самом
06592     // деле это сделано вручную через #undef. Чтобы подчеркнуть их локальную природу, у них имена заканчиваются на _.
06593     // Такие дефайны потом не перекосячат весь код после того как, фактически, стали уже не нужны.
06594     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06595 
06596     #undef ID_TEXT_
06597     #undef ID_INPUT_
06598 
06599     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06600     // Это статический объект, потому что строка в нем должна жить после завершения функции.
06601     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06602 
06603     static inputDlg dlg;
06604 
06605     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06606     // Передаем layout и запускаем окно диалога
06607     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06608 
06609     dlg.dialogBox (layout);
06610 
06611     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06612     // Возвращаем адрес строки из статического объекта. Так можно делать, потому что статический объект не умрет
06613     // при выходе из функции и строка в нем, соответственно, тоже. Адрес нестатических переменных передавать
06614     // синтаксически можно, но ведет к серьезным ошибкам.
06615     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06616 
06617     return dlg.str;
06618     }
06619 
06620 #endif // TX_COMPILED
06621 
06623 //}
06624 //=================================================================================================================
06625 
06626 //}
06627 //=================================================================================================================
06628

06632 //=================================================================================================================

06636 //{          The Includes
06637 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

06788 #define SYMOPT_EXACT_SYMBOLS                     0x00000400

06791 #define SYMOPT_INCLUDE_32BIT_MODULES             0x00002000
06792 #define SYMOPT_PUBLICS_ONLY                      0x00004000
06793 #define SYMOPT_NO_PUBLICS                        0x00008000
06794 #define SYMOPT_AUTO_PUBLICS                      0x00010000
06795 #define SYMOPT_NO_IMAGE_SEARCH                   0x00020000

06797 #define SYMOPT_NO_PROMPTS                        0x00080000

06802 #define SYMOPT_IGNORE_IMAGEDIR                   0x00200000

06811 #endif

06831 #endif
06832

06842 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER1       0x19930520  // '?msc' version magic, see ehdata.h
06843 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER2       0x19930521  // '?msc' version magic
06844 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER3       0x19930522  // '?msc' version magic
06845 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_PURE_MAGIC_NUMBER1  0x01994000  // '?msc' version magic
06846

06848 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC_UNWIND                 0x21474343  // '!GCC'
06849 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC_FORCED                 0x22474343  // '"GCC'
06850 
06851 #define EXCEPTION_CLR_FAILURE                    0xE0434f4D  // 'аCOM'
06852 
06853 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_BORLAND_BUILDER            0x0EEDFAE6  // Should never occur here
06854 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_BORLAND_DELPHI             0x0EEDFADE  // Should never occur here

06915 #undef  INTERFACE
06916 #define INTERFACE IShellLinkDataList
06917 
06918 DECLARE_INTERFACE_ (IShellLinkDataList, IUnknown)
06919     {
06920     // *** IUnknown methods ***
06921     STDMETHOD (QueryInterface)  (THIS_ REFIID iid, void** value)    _tx_override PURE;
06922     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)   (THIS)                              _tx_override PURE;
06923     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)  (THIS)                              _tx_override PURE;
06924 
06925     // *** IShellLinkDataList methods ***
06926     STDMETHOD (AddDataBlock)    (THIS_ void* dataBlock)             PURE;
06927     STDMETHOD (CopyDataBlock)   (THIS_ DWORD sig, void** dataBlock) PURE;
06928     STDMETHOD (RemoveDataBlock) (THIS_ DWORD sig)                   PURE;
06929     STDMETHOD (GetFlags)        (THIS_ DWORD* flags)                PURE;
06930     STDMETHOD (SetFlags)        (THIS_ DWORD  flags)                PURE;
06931 
06932     protected:
06933     virtual ~IShellLinkDataList();
06934     };

06936 const GUID IID_IShellLink         = {0x000214ee, 0x0000, 0x0000, {0xc0,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x46}};
06937 const GUID IID_IShellLinkDataList = {0x45e2b4ae, 0xb1c3, 0x11d0, {0xb9,0x2f,0x00,0xa0,0xc9,0x03,0x12,0xe1}};
06938 const GUID IID_IPersistFile       = {0x0000010b, 0x0000, 0x0000, {0xc0,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x46}};
06939 
06940 const GUID CLSID_SpVoice          = {0x96749377, 0x3391, 0x11d2, {0x9e,0xe3,0x00,0xc0,0x4f,0x79,0x73,0x96}};
06941 const GUID IID_ISpVoice           = {0x6c44df74, 0x72b9, 0x4992, {0xa1,0xec,0xef,0x99,0x6e,0x04,0x22,0xd4}};

06965     {

07121     };

07123 typedef bool    (__stdcall *PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE64)   (HANDLE process, DWORD64 baseAddress, void* buffer, DWORD size, DWORD* bytesRead);
07124 typedef void*   (__stdcall *PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE64) (HANDLE process, DWORD64 baseAddress);
07125 typedef DWORD64 (__stdcall *PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE64)       (HANDLE process, DWORD64 address);
07126 typedef DWORD64 (__stdcall *PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE64)     (HANDLE process, HANDLE thread, ADDRESS64* address);
07127 
07128 typedef void (*unexpected_handler)();
07129 
07130 #pragma pack (push, 4)
07131 
07132 struct MINIDUMP_THREAD_CALLBACK
07133     {
07134     ULONG    ThreadId;
07135     HANDLE   ThreadHandle;
07136     CONTEXT  Context;
07137     ULONG    SizeOfContext;
07138     ULONG64  StackBase;
07139     ULONG64  StackEnd;
07140     };

07143     {
07144     ULONG    ThreadId;
07145     HANDLE   ThreadHandle;
07146     CONTEXT  Context;

07148     ULONG64  StackBase;
07149     ULONG64  StackEnd;
07150     ULONG64  BackingStoreBase;
07151     ULONG64  BackingStoreEnd;
07152     };
07153 
07154 struct MINIDUMP_MODULE_CALLBACK
07155     {
07156     wchar_t* FullPath;
07157     ULONG64  BaseOfImage;
07158     ULONG    SizeOfImage;
07159     ULONG    CheckSum;
07160     ULONG    TimeDateStamp;
07161     VS_FIXEDFILEINFO VersionInfo;
07162     void*    CvRecord;
07163     ULONG    SizeOfCvRecord;
07164     PVOID    MiscRecord;
07165     ULONG    SizeOfMiscRecord;
07166     };
07167
