07169     {
07170     ULONG    ThreadId;
07171     };
07172 
07173 struct MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_MODULE_CALLBACK
07174     {
07175     ULONG64  BaseOfImage;
07176     };
07177 
07178 struct MINIDUMP_MEMORY_INFO
07179     {
07180     ULONG64  BaseAddress;
07181     ULONG64  AllocationBase;
07182     ULONG32  AllocationProtect;
07183     ULONG32  __alignment1;
07184     ULONG64  RegionSize;
07185     ULONG32  State;
07186     ULONG32  Protect;
07187     ULONG32  Type;
07188     ULONG32  __alignment2;
07189     };
07190 
07191 struct MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM
07192     {
07193     ULONG32  Type;
07194     ULONG    BufferSize;
07195     PVOID    Buffer;
07196     };
07197 
07198 struct MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM_INFORMATION
07199     {
07200     ULONG                 UserStreamCount;
07201     MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM* UserStreamArray;
07202     };
07203 
07204 struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INPUT
07205     {
07206     ULONG    ProcessId;
07207     HANDLE   ProcessHandle;
07208     ULONG    CallbackType;
07209 
07210     union
07211         {
07212         MINIDUMP_THREAD_CALLBACK         Thread;
07213         MINIDUMP_THREAD_EX_CALLBACK      ThreadEx;
07214         MINIDUMP_MODULE_CALLBACK         Module;
07215         MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_THREAD_CALLBACK IncludeThread;
07216         MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_MODULE_CALLBACK IncludeModule;
07217         };
07218     };
07219 
07220 struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT
07221     {
07222     union
07223         {
07224         ULONG ModuleWriteFlags;
07225         ULONG ThreadWriteFlags;
07226         ULONG SecondaryFlags;
07227 
07228         struct
07229             {
07230             ULONG64  MemoryBase;
07231             ULONG    MemorySize;
07232             };
07233 
07234         struct
07235             {
07236             unsigned CheckCancel;
07237             unsigned Cancel;
07238             };
07239 
07240         HANDLE Handle;
07241         };
07242 
07243     struct
07244         {
07245         MINIDUMP_MEMORY_INFO VmRegion;
07246         unsigned             Continue;
07247         };
07248 
07249     HRESULT Status;
07250     };
07251 
07252 struct MINIDUMP_EXCEPTION_INFORMATION
07253     {
07254     DWORD               ThreadId;
07255     EXCEPTION_POINTERS* ExceptionPointers;
07256     unsigned            ClientPointers;
07257     };
07258 
07259 typedef int (WINAPI* MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_ROUTINE) (void* param, MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INPUT* input, MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT* output);
07260 
07261 struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INFORMATION
07262     {
07263     MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_ROUTINE CallbackRoutine;
07264     void*                     CallbackParam;
07265     };
07266 
07267 enum MINIDUMP_TYPE
07268     {
07269     MiniDumpNormal                         = 0x00000000,
07270     MiniDumpWithDataSegs                   = 0x00000001,
07271     MiniDumpWithFullMemory                 = 0x00000002,
07272     MiniDumpWithHandleData                 = 0x00000004,
07273     MiniDumpFilterMemory                   = 0x00000008,
07274     MiniDumpScanMemory                     = 0x00000010,
07275     MiniDumpWithUnloadedModules            = 0x00000020,
07276     MiniDumpWithIndirectlyReferencedMemory = 0x00000040,
07277     MiniDumpFilterModulePaths              = 0x00000080,
07278     MiniDumpWithProcessThreadData          = 0x00000100,
07279     MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory     = 0x00000200,
07280     MiniDumpWithoutOptionalData            = 0x00000400,
07281     MiniDumpWithFullMemoryInfo             = 0x00000800,
07282     MiniDumpWithThreadInfo                 = 0x00001000,
07283     MiniDumpWithCodeSegs                   = 0x00002000,
07284     MiniDumpWithoutAuxiliaryState          = 0x00004000,
07285     MiniDumpWithFullAuxiliaryState         = 0x00008000,
07286     MiniDumpWithPrivateWriteCopyMemory     = 0x00010000,
07287     MiniDumpIgnoreInaccessibleMemory       = 0x00020000,
07288     MiniDumpWithTokenInformation           = 0x00040000
07289     };
07290 
07291 #ifndef CONTEXT_ALL
07292 #define CONTEXT_ALL              ( CONTEXT_CONTROL | CONTEXT_INTEGER | CONTEXT_SEGMENTS | CONTEXT_FLOATING_POINT | CONTEXT_DEBUG_REGISTERS )
07293 #endif
07294 
07295 #pragma pack (pop)
07296 
07297 } // namespace Win32
07298 
07299 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07300 
07301 #define FOREGROUND_BLACK         ( 0                                                         )
07302 #define FOREGROUND_CYAN          ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_GREEN                  )
07303 #define FOREGROUND_MAGENTA       ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_RED                    )
07304 #define FOREGROUND_DARKYELLOW    ( FOREGROUND_GREEN      | FOREGROUND_RED                    )
07305 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY     ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED )
07306 #define FOREGROUND_DARKGRAY      (                         FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07307 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTBLUE     ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07308 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTGREEN    ( FOREGROUND_GREEN      | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07309 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTCYAN     ( FOREGROUND_CYAN       | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07310 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTRED      ( FOREGROUND_RED        | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07311 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTMAGENTA  ( FOREGROUND_MAGENTA    | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07312 #define FOREGROUND_YELLOW        ( FOREGROUND_DARKYELLOW | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07313 #define FOREGROUND_WHITE         ( FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY  | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07314 
07315 #define BACKGROUND_BLACK         ( 0                                                         )
07316 #define BACKGROUND_CYAN          ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_GREEN                  )
07317 #define BACKGROUND_MAGENTA       ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_RED                    )
07318 #define BACKGROUND_DARKYELLOW    ( BACKGROUND_GREEN      | BACKGROUND_RED                    )
07319 #define BACKGROUND_GRAY          ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED )
07320 #define BACKGROUND_DARKGRAY      (                         BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07321 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTBLUE     ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07322 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTGREEN    ( BACKGROUND_GREEN      | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07323 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTCYAN     ( BACKGROUND_CYAN       | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07324 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTRED      ( BACKGROUND_RED        | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07325 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTMAGENTA  ( BACKGROUND_MAGENTA    | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07326 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTYELLOW   ( BACKGROUND_DARKYELLOW | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07327 #define BACKGROUND_WHITE         ( BACKGROUND_DARKGRAY   | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07328 
07329 //}
07330 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07331 
07332 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07333 //{ There are copies of MSVC compiler built-in predefined definitions, which are wrong in 64-bit mode.
07334 //  So we have to override them. See: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39113168
07335 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07336 
07337 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07338 
07339 #if defined (_MSC_VER)
07340                                                     //  MS ABI C++ Exception Layout
07341 namespace Win32 {                                   //  ---------------------------
07342                                                     //
07343 #pragma pack (push, 4)                              //   EXCEPTION_RECORD:
07344                                                     //  +==================================================+
07345 struct ThrowInfo                                    //  |...                                               |
07346     {                                               //  |NumberParameters:        3, 4 or more             |
07347     __int32 attributes;                             //  |ExceptionInformation[0]: MS signature 0x19930520  |
07348     __int32 pmfnUnwind;                             //  |ExceptionInformation[1]: object* thrown           |
07349     __int32 pForwardCompat;                         //  |ExceptionInformation[2]: ThrowInfo* --------------+---+
07350     __int32 pCatchableTypeArray;                    //  |ExceptionInformation[3]: ImageBase (if params > 3)|   |
07351     };                                              //  +==================================================+   |
07352                                                     //                                                         |
07353 struct CatchableTypeArray                           //        ThrowInfo:                                       |
07354     {                                               //        +======================================+ <-------+
07355     __int32 nCatchableTypes;                        //        |   ...                                |
07356     __int32 arrayOfCatchableTypes[];                //  +-----+-- pCatchableTypeArray (ptr/RVA)      |
07357     };                                              //  |     +======================================+
07358                                                     //  |
07359 struct CatchableType                                //  |     CatchableTypeArray:
07360     {                                               //  +---> +======================================+
07361     __int32 properties;                             //        |   ...                                |
07362     __int32 pType;                                  //  +-----+-- arrayOfCatchableTypes[0] (ptr/RVA) |
07363     __int32 thisDisplacement[3]; // struct _PMD     //  |     +======================================+
07364     __int32 sizeOrOffset;                           //  |
07365     __int32 copyFunction;                           //  |     CatchableType:
07366     };                                              //  +---> +====================+
07367                                                     //        | ...                |        std::type_info:
07368 #pragma pack (pop)                                  //        | pType (ptr/RVA) ---+------> +==================+
07369                                                     //        | ...                |        |type_info data    |
07370 } // namespace Win32                                //        +====================+        |...               |
07371                                                     //                                      +==================+
07372 #endif
07373 
07374 // Similar to __CxxDetectRethrow(), see C:\Bin\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\crt\src\crtsrc\vcruntime\frame.cpp:
07375 
07376 #define _TX_MSC__CXX_DETECT_RETHROW( exc )                                     \
07377     (                                                                          \
07378     (exc)                                          &&                          \
07379     (exc) -> ExceptionCode    == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC &&                          \
07380     (exc) -> NumberParameters >= 3                 &&                          \
07381                                                                                \
07382     ((exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER1 ||  \
07383      (exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER2 ||  \
07384      (exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER3) && \
07385                                                                                \
07386     (exc) -> ExceptionInformation[2] == 0                                      \
07387     )
07388 
07389 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07390 
07391 //}
07392 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07393 
07394 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07395 //{ The corresponding structures for GCC
07396 //
07397 //  From: http://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/blob/master/libstdc%2B%2B-v3/libsupc%2B%2B/unwind-cxx.h
07398 //  See:  http://mentorembedded.github.io/cxx-abi/abi-eh.html#cxx-abi
07399 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07400 
07401 #if defined (_GCC_VER)
07402 
07403 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07404 
07405                                                     // GCC ABI C++ Exception layout. A/B are ExceptionInformation[0].
07406 namespace ABI {                                     // --------------------------------------------------------------
07407                                                     //
07408 struct __cxa_exception                              // Case A: "_Unwind_Exception* A" is undependent exception:
07409     {                                               // --------------------------------------------------------
07410     union {                                         //
07411         struct                                      //           __cxa_exception:           std::type_info:
07412             {                                       //       -*--+====================+     +==================+
07413             ::std::type_info* exceptionType;        //        ^  |exceptionType* -----+---->|type_info data    |
07414             void (*exceptionDestructor)(void*);     //        |  |...                 |     |...               |
07415             };                                      //       -1  |                    |     +==================+
07416         struct                                      //        |  |                    |
07417             {                                       // A >----|--+--------------------+
07418             __cxa_exception*  primaryException;     //     |  |  |unwindHeader        |
07419             void (*padding)();                      //    +1  |  |                    |
07420             };                                      //     |  |  |                    |
07421         };                                          //     V  |  |                    |
07422                                                     //    -*---  +====================+
07423     std::unexpected_handler   unexpectedHandler;    //           |object              |
07424     std::terminate_handler    terminateHandler;     //           +--------------------+
07425                                                     //
07426     __cxa_exception*          nextException;        // Case B: "_Unwind_Exception* B" is dependent exception
07427     int                       handlerCount;         // (unwindHeader.exception_class & 1 != 0):
07428     int                       handlerSwitchValue;   // -----------------------------------------------------
07429     const unsigned char*      actionRecord;         //
07430     const unsigned char*      languageSpecificData; //           __cxa_exception:               __cxa_exception:
07431     void*                     catchTemp;            //       -*--+====================+     -*--+=================+
07432     void*                     adjustedPtr;          //        ^  |primaryException* --+--    ^  |exceptionType*   |
07433                                                     //        |  |...                 |  \   |  |...              |
07434     _Unwind_Exception         unwindHeader;         //       -1  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07435     };                                              //        |  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07436                                                     // B >----|--+--------------------+  |  -1  +-----------------+
07437 struct __cxa_eh_globals                             //     |  |  |unwindHeader        |  |   |  |unwindHeader     |
07438     {                                               //    +1  |  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07439     __cxa_exception* caughtExceptions;              //     |  |  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07440     unsigned int     uncaughtExceptions;            //     V  |  |                    |  \   |  |                 |
07441     };                                              //    -*---  +====================+   -->*--+=================+
07442                                                     //           |...                 |         |object           |
07443 } // namespace ABI                                  //           .                    .         |                 |
07444                                                     //                                          +-----------------+
07445 
07446 extern "C" ABI::__cxa_eh_globals* __cxa_get_globals();
07447 
07448 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07449 
07450 #endif
07451 
07452 //}
07453 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07454 
07455 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07456 //{ Hand-made IAT.
07457 //  Some IDEs don't link with these libs by default in console projects, so do sunrise by hand. :(
07458 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07459 
07460 // Hand-made DLLIMPORT helpers
07461 
07462 #define _TX_DLLIMPORT(     lib, retval, name, params ) \
07463      retval (WINAPI* name) params = (retval (WINAPI*) params) _txDllImport (lib ".dll", #name, true)
07464 
07465 #define _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT( lib, retval, name, params ) \
07466      retval (WINAPI* name) params = (retval (WINAPI*) params) _txDllImport (lib ".dll", #name, false)
07467 
07468 #define _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT( lib, retval, name, params ) \
07469      retval (      * name) params = (retval (      *) params) _txDllImport (lib ".dll", #name, false)
07470 
07471 typedef void (*_tx_FARPROC)();
07472 
07473 _tx_FARPROC _txDllImport (const char dllFileName[], const char funcName[], bool required = true);
07474 
07475 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07476 
07477 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07478 
07479 namespace Win32 {
07480 
07481 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    HDC,      CreateCompatibleDC,            (HDC dc));
07482 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    HBITMAP,  CreateCompatibleBitmap,        (HDC dc, int width, int height));
07483 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    HGDIOBJ,  GetStockObject,                (int object));
07484 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    HGDIOBJ,  SelectObject,                  (HDC dc, HGDIOBJ object));
07485 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    HGDIOBJ,  GetCurrentObject,              (HDC dc, unsigned objectType));
07486 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    int,      GetObjectA,                    (HGDIOBJ obj, int bufsize, void* buffer));
07487 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    DWORD,    GetObjectType,                 (HGDIOBJ object));
07488 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    bool,     DeleteDC,                      (HDC dc));
07489 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("GDI32",    bool,     DeleteObject,                  (HGDIOBJ object));

07587                                                                          void* processInfo, unsigned long szProcessInfo, unsigned long* szReturnInfo));
07588 
07589 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   void,     exit,                          (int retcode));
07590 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   void,     _cexit,                        (void));
07591 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   unsigned, _fpreset,                      (void));
07592 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   unsigned, _controlfp,                    (unsigned control, unsigned mask));
07593 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   uintptr_t,_beginthread,                  (void (__cdecl* start_address) (void*), unsigned stack_size, void* arglist));
07594 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   uintptr_t,_beginthreadex,                (void* security, unsigned stack_size, unsigned (__stdcall* start_address) (void*),
07595                                                                          void *arglist, unsigned init_flag, unsigned* thread_addr));
07596 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   char*,    __unDName,                     (char* outStr, const char* mangledName, int outStrLen,
07597                                                                          void* (*mallocFunc) (size_t size), void (*freeFunc) (void *pointer),
07598                                                                          unsigned short flags));
07599 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   unexpected_handler, set_unexpected,      (unexpected_handler handler));
07600 
07601 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("OpenGL32", HDC,         wglGetCurrentDC,            (void));
07602 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("OpenGL32", unsigned,    glGetError,                 (void));
07603 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("Glu32",    const char*, gluErrorString,             (unsigned error));
07604 
07605 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     MiniDumpWriteDump,             (HANDLE process, DWORD processId, HANDLE file, MINIDUMP_TYPE dumpType,
07606                                                                          MINIDUMP_EXCEPTION_INFORMATION*   exceptionParam,
07607                                                                          MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM_INFORMATION* userStreamParam,
07608                                                                          MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INFORMATION*    callbackParam));
07609 
07610 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", DWORD,    SymSetOptions,                 (DWORD options));
07611 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymInitialize,                 (HANDLE process, const char userSearchPath[], bool invadeProcess));
07612 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymFromAddr,                   (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD64* offset, SYMBOL_INFO*     symbol));
07613 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymGetLineFromAddr64,          (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD*   offset, IMAGEHLP_LINE64* line));
07614 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", DWORD64,  SymGetModuleBase64,            (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr));
07615 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymCleanup,                    (HANDLE process));
07616 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", void*,    SymFunctionTableAccess64,      (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addrBase));
07617 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     StackWalk64,                   (DWORD arch, HANDLE process, HANDLE thread, STACKFRAME64* frame, void* ctxRecord,
07618                                                                          PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE64   readMemoryFunc,
07619                                                                          PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE64 tableAccessFunc,
07620                                                                          PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE64       getModuleBaseFunc,
07621                                                                          PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE64     translateAddressFunc));
07622 namespace MinGW {
07623 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", DWORD,    SymSetOptions,                 (DWORD options));
07624 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymInitialize,                 (HANDLE process, const char userSearchPath[], bool invadeProcess));
07625 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymFromAddr,                   (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD64* offset, SYMBOL_INFO*     symbol));
07626 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymGetLineFromAddr64,          (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD*   offset, IMAGEHLP_LINE64* line));
07627 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", DWORD64,  SymGetModuleBase64,            (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr));
07628 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymCleanup,                    (HANDLE process));
07629 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", void*,    SymFunctionTableAccess64,      (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addrBase));
07630 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     StackWalk64,                   (DWORD arch, HANDLE process, HANDLE thread, STACKFRAME64* frame, void* ctxRecord,
07631                                                                          PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE64   readMemoryFunc,
07632                                                                          PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE64 tableAccessFunc,
07633                                                                          PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE64       getModuleBaseFunc,
07634                                                                          PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE64     translateAddressFunc));
07635 } // namespace MinGW
07636 } // namespace Win32
07637 
07638 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07639 
07640 //}
07641 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07642 
07644 //}

07790                                               const char msg[] = NULL, ...) tx_printfy (5);

07805 
07806 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07807 // There are macros for __FILE__ and __LINE__ to work properly.
07808 
07809 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
07810 
07811     #define  _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED( cond )       ( !(cond) &&                                          \
07812                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS, 0), 1) && \
07813                                                      (assert (cond), true) )
07814 
07815     #define  _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()             ( !txOK() &&                                          \
07816                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) && \
07817                                                      (TX_ERROR ("\a" "Окно рисования не создано или не в порядке."), 1) )
07818 
07819     #define  _TX_HDC_FAILED( dc )              ( !Win32::GetObjectType (dc) &&                       \
07820                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) && \
07821                                                      (TX_ERROR ("Параметр \"%s\" неверен. Возможно, этот холст не создан, " \
07822                                                                 "или уже уничтожен, или не загрузилась картинка.", #dc), 1) )
07823     #define _TX_DEFAULT_HDC_FAILED(dc)         ( (!(dc) &&                                           \
07824                                                      _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()) || _TX_HDC_FAILED (dc) )
07825 
07826 #else
07827     #define  _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED( cond )       ( !(cond) &&                                          \
07828                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS, 0), 1) )
07829 
07830     #define  _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()             ( !txOK() &&                                          \
07831                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) )
07832 
07833     #define  _TX_HDC_FAILED( dc )              ( !Win32::GetObjectType (dc) &&                       \
07834                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) )
07835 
07836     #define _TX_DEFAULT_HDC_FAILED(dc)         ( !(dc) &&                                            \
07837                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) )
07838 #endif
07839 
07840 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07841 // Take action in debug configuration only.
07842 // Definition ({ expr; }) would be better, but MSVC rejects it. So sad. :'(
07843 
07844 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
07845     #define  _TX_ON_DEBUG( code )              { code; }
07846 #else
07847     #define  _TX_ON_DEBUG( code )              ;
07848 #endif
07849 
07850 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07851 // Invokes an error without location information. "$$" restores TX-related call location context
07852 
07853 #define _TX_UNEXPECTED( ... )                  $$ _txError (NULL, 0, NULL, 0, ##__VA_ARGS__)
07854 
07855 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07856 // Safe call of a function via its pointer
07857 
07858 #define _TX_CALL(  func, param )               ( (func)? ((func) param) :       0 )
07859 #define _TX_CALLv( func, param )               ( (func)? ((func) param) : (void)0 )
07860 
07861 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07862 // This is a macro because cond is an expression and is not always a function. Lack of lambdas in pre-C++0x.
07863 
07864 #define _txWaitFor( cond, time )               { for (DWORD _t = GetTickCount() + (time); \
07865                                                       !(cond) && GetTickCount() < _t;     \
07866                                                       Sleep (_txWindowUpdateInterval)) ;  \
07867                                                  if  (!(cond))                            \
07868                                                       _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Timeout: " #cond "."); }
07869 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07870 // Detouring in case of SEH mechanism
07871 
07872 #define _txSetJmp()                            ( setjmp (_txDumpExceptionObjJmp) == 0 )
07873 
07874 #define _txClearJmp()                          { *(unsigned long long*) _txDumpExceptionObjJmp = 0; }
07875 
07876 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07877 // IN and OUT are defined in WinDef.h to support Microsoft SAL. Remove them because they are often confused with user's code.
07878 
07879 #if defined (IN)
07880     #undef  IN
07881 #endif
07882 
07883 #if defined (IN)
07884     #undef  OUT
07885 #endif
07886 
07888 //}
07889 //=================================================================================================================
07890 
07891 //=================================================================================================================
07892 //{          Internal global data
07894 //
07895 //           Данные не упакованы в структуру или класс, для того, чтобы это сделали Вы сами :)
07896 //
07897 //           Если вы пишете свою библиотеку и используете TXLib.h как пример, не следуйте ему и не делайте так же.
07898 //           Здесь это сделано только в образовательных целях.
07899 //
07900 //           Будьте практичнее, сделайте структуру и глобальную функцию для доступа к ней, или класс.
07901 //=================================================================================================================
07903 
07904 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07905 
07906 const int                      _TX_IDM_ABOUT               = 40000,      // Идентификаторы системного меню окна
07907                                _TX_IDM_CONSOLE             = 40001,
07908                                _TX_WM_CREATEWND            = 0x7FF0,     // Сообщения для создания/уничтожения
07909                                _TX_WM_DESTROYWND           = 0x7FF1;     // окон в потоке Canvas
07910 
07911 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07912 
07913 int                            _txInitialized              = _TX_NOINIT || _txInitialize();
07914 
07915 volatile unsigned              _txCanaryFirst              = 0x776F656D; // A very system value
07916 
07917 volatile unsigned              _txMainThreadId             = 0;          // ID потока, где выполняется main()
07918 volatile HANDLE                _txMainThread               = NULL;       // Дексриптор этого потока
07919 
07920 volatile unsigned              _txCanvas_ThreadId          = 0;          // ID потока, владеющего окном холста TXLib
07921 volatile HANDLE                _txCanvas_Thread            = NULL;       // Дексриптор этого потока
07922 volatile HWND                  _txCanvas_Window            = NULL;       // Дескриптор окна холста TXLib
07923 
07924 HDC                            _txCanvas_BackBuf[2]        = {NULL,      // [0] Main TXLib in-memory DC, where user's pictures lies
07925                                                               NULL};     // [1] Image ready for auto-refresh, see txCanvas_OnPAINT()
07926 
07927 RGBQUAD*                       _txCanvas_Pixels            = NULL;       // Memory buffer of _txCanvas_BackBuf[0]
07928 
07929 HBITMAP                        _txStockBitmap              = NULL;       // Equivalent of GetStockObject (BITMAP),
07930                                                                          // see https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20100416-00/?p=14313
07931 
07932 CRITICAL_SECTION               _txCanvas_LockBackBuf       = {0,-1};     // Prevent simultaneous access to back buffer, see txLock()
07933 
07934 UINT_PTR                       _txCanvas_RefreshTimer      = 1;          // Timer ID to redraw TXLib window
07935 volatile int                   _txCanvas_RefreshLock       = 0;          // Blocks auto on-timer canvas update, see txBegin/txEnd
07936 
07937 ::std::vector<HDC>*            _txCanvas_UserDCs           = NULL;       // List of DCs allocated, for auto-free
07938 
07939 volatile bool                  _txConsole_IsBlinking       = true;       // To blink or not to blink, that is the question.
07940 
07941 bool                           _txConsole                  = false;      // Only first TXLib module in app can own the console
07942 bool                           _txMain                     = false;      // First TXLib wnd opened (closing it terminates program)
07943 bool                           _txIsDll                    = false;      // TXLib module is in DLL
07944 volatile bool                  _txRunning                  = false;      // main() is still running
07945 volatile bool                  _txExit                     = false;      // exit() is active
07946 
07947 volatile POINT                 _txMousePos                 = {-1,-1};    // Ask Captn Obviouos about it. See txCanvas_OnMOUSE()
07948 volatile unsigned              _txMouseButtons             = 0;
07949 
07950 volatile WNDPROC               _txAltWndProc               = NULL;       // Альтернативная оконная функция. См. txSetWindowsHook().
07951 
07952 _tx_thread _txLoc              _txLoc::Cur                 = {};         // Execution point tracking and trace state, see "$" macro
07953 
07954 volatile int                   _txErrors                   = 0;          // TX_ERROR calls sequental number
07955 volatile int                   _txOGLError                 = 0;          // Last OpenGL error when using tx_glGetError()
07956 volatile long                  _txSENumber                 = 0;          // SEH exceptions sequental number
07957 volatile long                  _txSEFatalNumber            = 0;          // SEH fatal exceptions sequental number
07958 char                           _txDumpSE [_TX_BUFSIZE]     = "";         // SEH dump data area
07959 char                           _txTraceSE[_TX_HUGEBUFSIZE] = "";         // Stack trace data area
07960 
07961 LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER   _txPrevUEFilter             = NULL;       // Previous UnhandledExceptionFilter
07962 
07963 jmp_buf                        _txDumpExceptionObjJmp      = {};         // Hook for _txDumpExceptionObj
07964 
07965 const volatile uintptr_t       _txForceImport[]            = { (uintptr_t) ::TerminateProcess,              (uintptr_t) ::ExitProcess,
07966                                                                (uintptr_t) ::FatalExit,                     (uintptr_t) ::FatalAppExitA,
07967                                                                (uintptr_t) ::exit,                          (uintptr_t) Win32::_controlfp,
07968                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::Polyline,                 (uintptr_t) Win32::PolyBezier,
07969                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::RoundRect,                (uintptr_t) Win32::RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler,
07970                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::PlgBlt,                   (uintptr_t) Win32::RtlCaptureStackBackTrace,
07971                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymInitialize,            (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymInitialize,
07972                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymSetOptions,            (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymSetOptions,
07973                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymGetLineFromAddr64,     (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymGetLineFromAddr64,
07974                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymFromAddr,              (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymFromAddr,
07975                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymCleanup,               (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymCleanup,
07976                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymGetModuleBase64,       (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymGetModuleBase64,
07977                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymFunctionTableAccess64, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymFunctionTableAccess64,
07978                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::StackWalk64,              (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::StackWalk64,
07979                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::StrStrIA,                 (uintptr_t) Win32::Wow64GetThreadContext };
07980 
07981 volatile unsigned              _txCanaryLast               = 0x5E2E2E5E; // Another very system value
07982 
07983 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07984 
07985 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07986 
07987 extern volatile unsigned _txCanaryFirst;
07988 extern volatile unsigned _txCanaryLast;
07989 extern volatile HWND     _txCanvas_Window;
07990 extern volatile unsigned _txCanvas_ThreadId;
07991 extern          HDC      _txCanvas_BackBuf[2];
07992 extern          RGBQUAD* _txCanvas_Pixels;
07993 extern volatile int      _txCanvas_RefreshLock;
07994 extern volatile WNDPROC  _txAltWndProc;
07995 extern volatile bool     _txExit;
07996 extern volatile int      _txOGLError;
07997 
07999 //}
08000 //=================================================================================================================
08001 
08002 //=================================================================================================================
08003 //{          TXLib engine init/check/cleanup
08005 //=================================================================================================================
08007 
08008 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08009 //{          Early initialization
08010 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08011 
08012 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08013 
08014 int _txInitialize()
08015     {
08016     if (_txInitialized) return 1;
08017     _txInitialized = 1;
08018 
08019     #if defined (_TX_ALLOC_BREAK) && defined (_MSC_VER)  // See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w2fhc9a3%28v=vs.90%29.aspx
08020     _CrtSetBreakAlloc (_TX_ALLOC_BREAK);                 // and http://support.microsoft.com/ru-ru/kb/151585
08021     #endif
08022 
08023     #if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
08024     _txLocLvlSet (1);
08025     #endif
08026 
08027     _TX_ON_DEBUG (OutputDebugString ("\n");
08028                   OutputDebugString (_TX_VERSION " - The Dumb Artist Library, " _TX_AUTHOR ": \"" __FILE__ "\" "
08029                                      "compiled " __DATE__ " " __TIME__ ", " _TX_BUILDMODE " mode, module: " _TX_MODULE "\n");
08030                   OutputDebugString ("\n"));
08031 
08032     _txMainThreadId = GetCurrentThreadId();
08033     _txMainThread   = OpenThread (THREAD_ALL_ACCESS, false, _txMainThreadId);
08034 
08035 $3  _txIsDll = _txInDll();
08036 
08037 $   if (!_txIsDll)
08038         {
08039 $       _txConsole = ! FindAtom ("_txConsole");
08040 $       (void)          AddAtom ("_txConsole");
08041         }
08042 
08043 $   if (_txConsole)
08044         {
08045 $       _txCheckSourceCP (_TX_CODEPAGE, true);
08046 
08047 $       unsigned long stackSize = _TX_STACKSIZE;
08048 $       _TX_CALL (Win32::SetThreadStackGuarantee, (&stackSize));
08049 
08050 $       _txOnSignal();
08051 
08052 $       if (!*_txLogName)
08053             {$ _tx_snprintf_s (_txLogName, sizeof (_txLogName) - 1, "%s.log", txGetModuleFileName()); }
08054 
08055 $       if (!_txIsDll)
08056             {
08057 $           _TX_CALL  (Win32::AddVectoredExceptionHandler, (1, (PVECTORED_EXCEPTION_HANDLER)  _txVectoredExceptionHandler));
08058 $           _txPrevUEFilter = SetUnhandledExceptionFilter  (   (LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER) _txUnhandledExceptionFilter);
08059             }
08060 
08061 $       ::std::set_terminate             (_txOnTerminate);
08062 $       ::std::set_new_handler           (_txOnNewHandlerAnsi);
08063 $       _TX_CALL (Win32::set_unexpected, (_txOnUnexpected));
08064 
08065         #if defined (_CLANG_VER) && !defined (_MSC_VER)
08066 $       ::std::__libcpp_debug_function = _txLibCppDebugFunction;
08067         #endif
08068 
08069 $       SetConsoleCtrlHandler (_txOnConsoleCtrlEvent, true);
08070 
08071 $       SetErrorMode (SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS | SEM_NOGPFAULTERRORBOX);
08072 
08073         #if defined (_MSC_VER)
08074 
08075 $       _set_printf_count_output (1);
08076 
08077 $       _set_new_handler (_txOnNewHandler);
08078 $       _set_new_mode (1);
08079 
08080         #if !defined (_CLANG_VER)
08081 
08082 $       _CrtSetDbgFlag (_CRTDBG_ALLOC_MEM_DF | _CRTDBG_CHECK_ALWAYS_DF | _CRTDBG_LEAK_CHECK_DF);
08083 $       _CrtSetAllocHook (_txOnAllocHook);
08084 
08085 $       unsigned mode = _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE;
08086 $       if (_CrtSetReportHook2 (_CRT_RPTHOOK_INSTALL, (_CRT_REPORT_HOOK) _txOnErrorReport) > 0) mode = 0;
08087 
08088 $       _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_WARN,   _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode);
08089 $       _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_ERROR,  _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode | _CRTDBG_MODE_WNDW);
08090 $       _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode | _CRTDBG_MODE_WNDW);
08091 $       _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_WARN,   _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
08092 $       _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_ERROR,  _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
08093 $       _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
08094 
08095         #endif
08096 
08097 $       _set_abort_behavior (_WRITE_ABORT_MSG, _WRITE_ABORT_MSG);
08098 $       _set_abort_behavior (0,                _CALL_REPORTFAULT);
08099 
08100 $       _RTC_SetErrorFunc              (_txOnRTCFailure);
08101 $       _set_purecall_handler          (_txOnPureCall);
08102 $       _set_invalid_parameter_handler (_txOnInvalidParam);
08103 
08104         #endif
08105 
08106         #if defined (__STDC_LIB_EXT1__)
08107 $       ::std::set_constraint_handler_s (_txOnSecurityErrorAnsi);
08108         #endif
08109 
08110         #if !defined (__CYGWIN__) && defined (_GCC_VER) && (_GCC_VER >= 530) && !defined (i386)
08111 $       __setusermatherr (_txOnMatherr);
08112         #endif
08113 
08114         #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
08115 $       _set_error_mode (_OUT_TO_MSGBOX | _OUT_TO_STDERR);
08116         #endif
08117 
08118 $       HWND console = _txConsole_Attach();
08119 $       SetWindowTextA (console, txGetModuleFileName (false));
08120         }
08121 
08122 $   InitializeCriticalSection (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf);
08123 
08124 $   _txSetProcAddress ("ExitProcess",                 (uintptr_t) _txOnExitProcess,                 "KERNEL32.DLL");
08125 $   _txSetProcAddress ("TerminateProcess",            (uintptr_t) _txOnTerminateProcess,            "KERNEL32.DLL");
08126 $   _txSetProcAddress ("FatalExit",                   (uintptr_t) _txOnFatalExit,                   "KERNEL32.DLL");
08127 $   _txSetProcAddress ("FatalAppExitA",               (uintptr_t) _txOnFatalAppExitA,               "KERNEL32.DLL");
08128 $   _txSetProcAddress ("UnhandledExceptionFilter",    (uintptr_t) _txUnhandledExceptionFilter,      "KERNEL32.DLL", true);
08129 $   _txSetProcAddress ("SetUnhandledExceptionFilter", (uintptr_t) _txOnSetUnhandledExceptionFilter, "KERNEL32.DLL");
08130 $   _txSetProcAddress ("exit",                        (uintptr_t) _txOnExit);
08131 $   _txSetProcAddress ("_cexit",                      (uintptr_t) _txOnCExit);
08132 
08133 $   atexit (_txCleanup);
08134 
08135 $   if (_txConsole)
08136         {
08137 $       txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
08138 
08139 $       tx_fpreset();
08140 
08141 $       srand ((unsigned) time (NULL));
08142 
08143 $       SetLastError (0);
08144 $       errno = 0;
08145 
08146         #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
08147 $       _doserrno = 0;
08148         #endif
08149         }
08150 
08151 $   HDC dc = Win32::CreateCompatibleDC (NULL); dc asserted;
08152 $   _txStockBitmap = (HBITMAP) Win32::SelectObject (dc, Win32::CreateCompatibleBitmap (dc, 1, 1)); _txStockBitmap asserted;
08153 $   Win32::DeleteObject (Win32::SelectObject (dc, _txStockBitmap)) asserted;
08154 $   Win32::DeleteDC (dc) asserted;
08155 
08156 $   return 1;
08157     }
08158 
08159 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08160 
08161 bool _txCheckSourceCP (int needCP /*= _TX_CODEPAGE*/, bool verbose /*= true*/)
08162     {
08163 $3  const char* sCodePage = NULL;
08164 $   int codePage = 0;
08165 
08166 $   switch (((unsigned const char*) "А") [0])
08167         {
08168         case 192: {$ codePage =  1251; sCodePage = "1251.";          break; }
08169         case 208: {$ codePage = 65001; sCodePage = "UTF-8.";         break; }
08170         case 128: {$ codePage =   866; sCodePage = "866.";           break; }
08171         case 225: {$ codePage = 20866; sCodePage = "KOI-8, waaat?!"; break; }
08172         default:  {$ codePage =    -1; sCodePage = "(Unknown)";      break; }
08173         }
08174 
08175 $   if (codePage != needCP && verbose)
08176         {
08177 $       *_txTraceSE = ' ';  // No stack trace please
08178 
08179 $       _TX_UNEXPECTED ("\v\t" "\n\n" "WARNING: CHECK TXLib.h file CODEPAGE. Maybe it is %s It should be %d.\n\n"
08180                         "This is NOT an error of TXLib itself. Please note:\n\n"
08181                         "Do NOT copy-and-paste TXLib.h file contents into a new file and them save it inside your "
08182                         "IDE or editor. This can change original TXLib codepage (%d) to another one. Instead, DO "
08183                         "use copy / move / cut-and-paste operations in Windows Explorer (Far Manager etc) only. "
08184                         "Or, when you see TXLib.h being opened in browser, use 'Save as...' (Ctrl+S) command.\n\n"
08185                         "Now you should re-download TXLib.h file from the http://txlib.ru site.\n\n"
08186                         "You can continue, but Russian messages and symbols may appear unreadable.",
08187                         sCodePage, needCP, needCP);
08188         }
08189 
08190 $   return (codePage == needCP);
08191     }
08192 
08193 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08194 
08195 _tx_FARPROC _txDllImport (const char dllFileName[], const char funcName[], bool required /*= true*/)
08196     {
08197     if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (dllFileName && *dllFileName)) return NULL;
08198     if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (funcName    && *funcName))    return NULL;
08199 
08200     static char dllPaths [2][MAX_PATH] = {"", ""};
08201 
08202     if (!*dllPaths[0])
08203         {
08204         const char dllDir[]  = "\\Windows\\";
08205 
08206         // dllPaths[0] is relative to the TX Setup directory stored in the Registry
08207 
08208         char* path = dllPaths[0];
08209 
08210         txRegQuery ("HKCU\\Software\\TX Library", "ProductDir", path, MAX_PATH);
08211         strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, dllDir, sizeof (dllDir) - 1);
08212 
08213         // dllPaths[1] is relative to TXib.h file used in compilation
08214 
08215         path = dllPaths[1];
08216 
08217         if (strchr (__FILE__, ':'))
08218             {
08219             strncpy_s (path, MAX_PATH, __FILE__, sizeof (__FILE__) - 1);
08220             }
08221         else
08222             {
08223             GetCurrentDirectory (MAX_PATH, path);
08224             strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, "\\" __FILE__, sizeof ("\\" __FILE__) - 1);
08225             }
08226 
08227         if (char* dir = strrchr (path, '\\')) *dir = 0;
08228 
08229         strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, dllDir, sizeof (dllDir) - 1);
08230         }
08231 
08232     char dllName[MAX_PATH] = "", dllArch[MAX_PATH] = "";
08233     const char* arch = (dllFileName? strchr (dllFileName, '*') : NULL);
08234 
08235     if (arch)
08236         {
08237         assert (arch >= dllFileName);
08238 
08239         strncpy_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), dllFileName, (size_t) (arch - dllFileName));
08240         strncat_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), arch+1, sizeof (dllName) - 1 - strlen (dllName));
08241 
08242         strncpy_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), dllFileName, (size_t) (arch - dllFileName));
08243         strncat_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), sizeof (void*) == 8? "64" : "32", 3);
08244         strncat_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), arch+1, sizeof (dllArch) - 1 - strlen (dllArch));
08245         }
08246     else if (dllFileName)
08247         {
08248         strncat_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), dllFileName, sizeof (dllName) - 1);
08249         }
08250 
08251     HMODULE   dll = GetModuleHandle (dllFileName);
08252 
08253     if (!dll) dll = GetModuleHandle (dllArch);
08254     if (!dll) dll = GetModuleHandle (dllName);
08255 
08256     for (int i = 0; !dll && i < (int) sizearr (dllPaths); i++)
08257         {
08258         char path [MAX_PATH] = "";
08259         strncpy_s (path, sizeof (path), dllPaths[i], sizeof (dllPaths[i]));
08260         size_t len = strlen (path);
08261 
08262         strncpy_s (path + len, sizeof (path) - len, dllArch, sizeof (dllArch));
08263         if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (path);
08264 
08265         strncpy_s (path + len, sizeof (path) - len, dllName, sizeof (dllName));
08266         if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (path);
08267         }
08268 
08269     if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (dllArch);
08270     if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (dllName);
08271 
08272     if (!dll  && required) TX_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot load library \"%s%s%s\".",
08273                                            dllName, (arch? "\" / \"" : ""), dllArch);
08274     if (!dll) return NULL;
08275 
08276     _tx_FARPROC addr = (_tx_FARPROC) GetProcAddress (dll, funcName);
08277 
08278     if (!addr && required) TX_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot import \"%s\" from library \"%s%s%s\".",
08279                                            funcName, dllName, (arch? "\" / \"" : ""), dllArch);
08280     return addr;
08281     }
08282 
08283 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08284 
08285 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER == 1800) // MSVC 2013
08286     #pragma warning (push)
08287     #pragma warning (disable: 6102)          // Использование 'name' из завершившегося ошибкой вызова функции
08288 #endif
08289 
08290 int txRegQuery (const char* keyName, const char* valueName, void* value, size_t szValue)
08291     {
08292     if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (keyName)) return 0;
08293 
08294     HKEY hive = NULL;
08295 
08296     #define EQU_(name1, name2)  ( _strnicmp (keyName, name1 "\\", sizeof (name1)) == 0 || \
08297                                   _strnicmp (keyName, name2 "\\", sizeof (name2)) == 0 )
08298 
08299     if      (EQU_("HKLM", "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE"))  hive = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE;
08300     else if (EQU_("HKCU", "HKEY_CURRENT_USER"))   hive = HKEY_CURRENT_USER;
08301     else if (EQU_("HKCR", "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT"))   hive = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT;
08302     else if (EQU_("HKU",  "HKEY_USERS"))          hive = HKEY_USERS;
08303     else if (EQU_("HKCC", "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG")) hive = HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG;
08304 
08305     else { _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (("keyName должно начинаться с HKLM\\, HKCU\\, HKCR\\, HKU\\ или HKCC\\ ", hive)); return 0; }
08306 
08307     #undef EQU_
08308 
08309     keyName = strchr (keyName, '\\') + 1;
08310 
08311     HKEY  key  = NULL;
08312     DWORD size = 0;
08313 
08314     bool                               ok  = !!RegOpenKeyEx    (hive, keyName,   0, KEY_QUERY_VALUE, &key)         == ERROR_SUCCESS;
08315     if (ok)                            ok &= !!RegQueryValueEx (key,  valueName, NULL, NULL, NULL,          &size) == ERROR_SUCCESS;
08316     if (ok && value && size < szValue) ok &= !!RegQueryValueEx (key,  valueName, NULL, NULL, (BYTE*) value, &size) == ERROR_SUCCESS;
08317     if (key)                           ok &= !!RegCloseKey     (key);
08318 
08319     return size;
08320     }
08321 
08322 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER == 1800)
08323     #pragma warning (pop)
08324 #endif
08325 
08326 #endif // TX_COMPILED
08327 
08328 //}
08329 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08330 
08331 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08332 
08333 HWND txCreateWindow (double sizeX, double sizeY, bool centered /*= true*/)
08334     {
08335 $1  if (!_txInitialized) _txInitialized = _txInitialize();
08336 
08337 $   if (HWND wnd = txWindow())
08338         {
08339 $       SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0);
08340 $       _TX_ON_DEBUG (TX_ERROR ("\a" "Окно рисования уже создано!"));
08341 $       return wnd;
08342         }
08343 
08344 $   if (!_txIsDll)
08345         {
08346 $       _txMain = ! FindAtom ("_txMain");  // Not a thread-safe
08347 $       (void)       AddAtom ("_txMain");
08348         }
08349 
08350 $   if (_txWindowUpdateInterval < 10) {$ _txWindowUpdateInterval = 10; }
08351 
08352 $   _txRunning = false;
08353 
08354     // Store the size
08355 
08356 $   static SIZE size = { ROUND (sizeX), ROUND (sizeY) };
08357 $   if (centered) { size.cx *= -1; size.cy *= -1; }
08358 
08359     // In Thread, where REAL creation lies...
08360 
08361 $   unsigned id = 0;
08362 $   _txCanvas_Thread = (HANDLE) Win32::_beginthreadex (NULL, 0, _txCanvas_ThreadProc, &size, 0, &id);
08363 
08364 $   if (!_txCanvas_Thread) return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot start canvas thread."),  (HWND) NULL;
08365 
08366 $   _txWaitFor (_txRunning, 10*_TX_TIMEOUT);
08367 
08368 $   if (!_txRunning)       return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot create canvas window."), (HWND) NULL;
08369 $   if (!txOK())           return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Canvas window is not OK."),     (HWND) NULL;
08370 
08371 $   HWND console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
08372 
08373 $   DWORD proc = 0;
08374 $   GetWindowThreadProcessId (console, &proc);
08375 
08376 $   if (console && (proc == GetCurrentProcessId() || _txIsParentWaitable()))
08377         {$ ShowWindow (console, _txConsoleMode); }
08378 
08379 $   HMENU menu = GetSystemMenu (txWindow(), false);
08380     if (menu) {$ CheckMenuItem (menu, _TX_IDM_CONSOLE, (console? (IsWindowVisible (console)? MF_CHECKED : 0) : MF_DISABLED)); }
08381 
08382 $   Win32::GdiSetBatchLimit (1);
08383 
08384 $   SetLastError (0);
08385 
08386 $   errno = 0;
08387 
08388     #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
08389 $   _doserrno = 0;
08390     #endif
08391 
08392 $   return txWindow();
08393     }
08394 
08395 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08396 
08397 HWND txCreateExtraWindow (CREATESTRUCT createData)
08398     {
08399 $1  if (_TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()) return NULL;
08400 
08401 $   volatile HWND wnd = NULL;
08402 $   createData.hInstance = (HINSTANCE)(uintptr_t) &wnd;
08403 
08404 $   PostMessage (txWindow(), _TX_WM_CREATEWND, 0, (LPARAM) &createData) asserted;
08405 
08406 $   _txWaitFor (wnd, 5*_TX_TIMEOUT);
08407 
08408 $   return wnd;
08409     }
08410 
08411 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08412 
08413 bool txSetDefaults (HDC dc /*= txDC()*/)
08414     {
08415 $1  if (dc == txDC()) txUpdateWindow (false);
08416 $   txAutoLock _lock;
08417 
08418 $   RECT r = {};
08419 $   GetClientRect (Win32::GetConsoleWindow(), &r) asserted;
08420 $   SIZE szCon = { r.right - r.left, r.bottom - r.top };
08421 
08422 $   HANDLE out = GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
08423 
08424 $   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO con = {{80, 25}, {}, 0, {0, 0, 80-1, 25-1}, {80, 25}};
08425 $   GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (out, &con);
08426 
08427 $   SIZE szTxt = { (short) (con.srWindow.Right  - con.srWindow.Left + 1),
08428                    (short) (con.srWindow.Bottom - con.srWindow.Top  + 1) };
08429 
08430 //{ Set defaults for graphics layer
08431 
08432 $   _txBuffer_Select (Win32::GetStockObject (WHITE_PEN),   dc) asserted;
08433 $   _txBuffer_Select (Win32::GetStockObject (WHITE_BRUSH), dc) asserted;
08434 
08435 $   _txBuffer_Select (Win32::CreateFont (szCon.cy/szTxt.cy, szCon.cx/szTxt.cx,
08436                                          0, 0, FW_REGULAR, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,
08437                                          RUSSIAN_CHARSET, OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS,
08438                                          DEFAULT_QUALITY, FIXED_PITCH, _txConsoleFont),
08439                       dc) asserted;
08440 
08441 $  (Win32::SetTextColor      (dc, TX_WHITE) != CLR_INVALID) asserted;
08442 $   Win32::SetBkMode         (dc, TRANSPARENT)              asserted;
08443 
08444 $   Win32::SetROP2           (dc, R2_COPYPEN)               asserted;
08445 $   Win32::SetStretchBltMode (dc, HALFTONE)                 asserted;
08446 
08447 //}
08448 
08449 $   if (dc != txDC())
08450         {$ return true; }
08451 
08452 //{ Set defaults for console  layer
08453 
08454 $   POINT szCanvas = txGetExtent (dc);
08455 
08456 $   HGDIOBJ font = txFontExist (_txConsoleFont)?
08457                        Win32::CreateFont (szCanvas.y/szTxt.cy, szCanvas.x/szTxt.cx,
08458                                           0, 0, FW_REGULAR, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,
08459                                           RUSSIAN_CHARSET, OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS,
08460                                           DEFAULT_QUALITY, FIXED_PITCH, _txConsoleFont)
08461                        :
08462                        Win32::GetStockObject (SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT);
08463 
08464 $   _txBuffer_Select (font, _txCanvas_BackBuf[1]);
08465 //}
08466 
08467 //{ Scroll the console for text to go above top of window and don't mix with graphics
08468 
08469 $   if (con.dwCursorPosition.X) _putch ('\n');
08470 
08471 $   short delta = (short) (con.dwCursorPosition.Y - con.srWindow.Top);
08472 
08473 $   con.srWindow.Top    = (short) (con.srWindow.Top    + delta);
08474 $   con.srWindow.Bottom = (short) (con.srWindow.Bottom + delta);
08475 
08476 $   SMALL_RECT src  = { 0, 0, (short) (con.dwSize.X - 1), (short) (con.dwSize.Y - 1) };
08477 $   CHAR_INFO  fill = { {' '}, FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY };
08478 $   COORD      dest = { 0, (short) -delta };  // New UL-corner of src, scroll up
08479 
08480 $   con.dwCursorPosition.X = 0;
08481 $   con.dwCursorPosition.Y = (short) (con.dwCursorPosition.Y - delta);
08482 
08483 $   (con.srWindow.Bottom < con.dwSize.Y &&                        // Move the "window"
08484      SetConsoleWindowInfo      (out, true, &con.srWindow))
08485     ||
08486     (ScrollConsoleScreenBuffer (out, &src, NULL, dest, &fill),    // Or scroll the buffer
08487      SetConsoleCursorPosition  (out, con.dwCursorPosition));
08488 //}
08489 
08490 $   txUpdateWindow (true);
08491 
08492     return true;
08493     }
08494 
08495 #endif // TX_COMPILED
08496 
08497 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08498 
08499 inline bool txOK()
08500     {
08501     return (_txCanaryFirst == 0x776F656D &&  // Too well-known values to use constants. You know these values, don't you?
08502             _txCanaryLast  == 0x5E2E2E5E &&
08503             _txCanvas_OK()
08504 
08505     #if defined (_MSC_VER)
08506          && _CrtCheckMemory()
08507     #endif
08508             );
08509     }
08510 
08511 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08512 //{          Cleanup
08513 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08514 
08515 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08516 
08517 // Implicit std(MSVCRT.dll)::_cexit() call before _txCleanup can lead to hangs in _cexit handlers chain.
08518 // So redefining ::std::_cexit(). Do it dynamically via PE Import Table hook to avoid duplicate symbols
08519 // if several modules linked together include TXLib.h. See _txSetProcAddress() call in _txInitialize().
08520 
08521 void _txOnCExit()
08522     {
08523     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08524     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s() called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__);
08525 
08526 $5  _txCleanup();
08527 
08528     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::_cexit()\n", _TX_VERSION);
08529     _TX_CALLv (Win32::_cexit, ());
08530     }
08531 
08532 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08533 
08534 void _txOnExit (int retcode)
08535     {
08536     if (retcode != 0)
08537         {
08538         OutputDebugString ("\n");
08539         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%d) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
08540         }
08541 
08542 $5  _txCleanup();
08543 
08544     if (retcode != 0)
08545         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::exit (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08546 
08547     Win32::exit (retcode);
08548     }
08549 
08550 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08551 
08552 void _txOnExitProcess (unsigned retcode)
08553     {
08554     if (retcode != 0)
08555         {
08556         OutputDebugString ("\n");
08557         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%u) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
08558         }
08559 
08560 $5  _txCleanup();
08561 
08562     if (retcode != 0)
08563         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::ExitProcess (%u)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08564 
08565     Win32::ExitProcess (retcode);
08566     }
08567 
08568 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08569 
08570 bool _txOnTerminateProcess (HANDLE process, unsigned retcode)
08571     {
08572     if (retcode != 0)
08573         {
08574         OutputDebugString ("\n");
08575         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (0x%p, %u) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, process, retcode);
08576         }
08577 
08578 $5  _txCleanup();
08579 
08580     if (retcode != 0)
08581         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::TerminateProcess (0x%p, %u)\n", _TX_VERSION, process, retcode);
08582 
08583     return Win32::TerminateProcess (process, retcode);
08584     }
08585 
08586 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08587 
08588 void _txOnFatalExit (int retcode)
08589     {
08590     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08591     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%d) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
08592 
08593 $5  _txCleanup();
08594 
08595     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::FatalExit (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08596     _TX_CALLv (Win32::FatalExit, (retcode));
08597 
08598     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: Win32::FatalExit() failure, calling Win32::TerminateProcess (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08599     Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), retcode);
08600     }
08601 
08602 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08603 
08604 void _txOnFatalAppExitA (unsigned action, const char message[])
08605     {
08606     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08607     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%u, \"%s\") called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, action, message);
08608 
08609 $5  _txCleanup();
08610 
08611     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::FatalAppExitA (%u, %s)\n", _TX_VERSION, action, message);
08612     _TX_CALLv (Win32::FatalAppExitA, (action, message));
08613 
08614     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: Win32::FatalExit() failure, calling Win32::TerminateProcess (EXIT_FAILURE)\n", _TX_VERSION);
08615     Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), EXIT_FAILURE);
08616     }
08617 
08618 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08619 
08620 BOOL WINAPI _txOnConsoleCtrlEvent (DWORD type)
08621     {
08622     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08623     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (0x%04lX) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, (unsigned long) type);
08624 
08625 $5  switch (type)
08626         {
08627         case CTRL_LOGOFF_EVENT:
08628         case CTRL_SHUTDOWN_EVENT: $ _txExit = true;
08629                                   $ _txCleanup();
08630         case CTRL_C_EVENT:
08631         case CTRL_CLOSE_EVENT:
08632         case CTRL_BREAK_EVENT:
08633 
08634         default:                  break;
08635         }
08636 
08637 $   return false;
08638     }
08639 
08640 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08641 
08642 void _txCleanup()
08643     {
08644     if (!_txInitialized) return;
08645     else _txInitialized = false;
08646 
08647 $3  _txRunning = false;
08648 $   _txConsole_IsBlinking = false;
08649 
08650 $   HWND canvas     = txWindow();
08651 $   HWND console    = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
08652 $   unsigned thread = GetCurrentThreadId();
08653 
08654 $   HWND wnd        = (canvas)? canvas : console;
08655 
08656 $   bool externTerm = (thread != _txMainThreadId &&
08657                        thread != _txCanvas_ThreadId);
08658 $   DWORD parent = 0;
08659 $   int  isParentWaitable = _txIsParentWaitable (&parent);
08660 $   bool waitableParent   = !externTerm && isParentWaitable;
08661 
08662 $   if (canvas)
08663         {$ txSleep (5*_txWindowUpdateInterval); }
08664 
08665 $   if (_txConsole)
08666         {
08667 $       if (_txMain) txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
08668 $       if (console) EnableWindow (console, true);
08669         }
08670 
08671 $   if (_txMain && !externTerm && wnd != NULL)
08672         {$ _txSetFinishedText (wnd); }
08673 
08674 $   _flushall();
08675 
08676 $   bool paused = false;
08677 $   if (((canvas? _txMain : _txConsole) && !_txExit) || (_txErrors && thread == _txMainThreadId))
08678         {
08679 $       if (wnd)
08680             {
08681             if (isParentWaitable >= 0) {$ SetWindowPos (wnd, HWND_NOTOPMOST, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_SHOWWINDOW); }
08682 $           EnableWindow (wnd, true);
08683             }
08684 
08685 $       if (console && isParentWaitable >= 0)
08686             {
08687 $           _txPauseBeforeTermination (canvas);
08688 $           paused = true;
08689             }
08690         }
08691 
08692 $   if (txWindow())
08693         {$ SendNotifyMessage (txWindow(), WM_DESTROY, 0, 0); }
08694 
08695 $   _txWaitFor (!txWindow(), 5*_TX_TIMEOUT);
08696 
08697 $   txSpeak     (NULL);
08698 $   txPlayVideo (NULL);
08699 
08700 $   if (GetCurrentThreadId() != _txMainThreadId)
08701         {$ SuspendThread (_txMainThread);    }
08702 $   if (GetCurrentThreadId() != _txCanvas_ThreadId)
08703         {$ SuspendThread (_txCanvas_Thread); }
08704 
08705 $   if (_txMainThread)
08706         {$ CloseHandle (_txMainThread)    asserted; _txMainThread    = NULL; }
08707 $   if (_txCanvas_Thread)
08708         {$ CloseHandle (_txCanvas_Thread) asserted; _txCanvas_Thread = NULL; }
08709 
08710 $   if (!txWindow())
08711         {$ DeleteCriticalSection (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf); CRITICAL_SECTION zero = {0, -1}; _txCanvas_LockBackBuf = zero; }
08712 
08713 $   console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
08714 
08715 $   if (_txMain && _txConsole)
08716         {$ _txConsole_Detach (waitableParent && !externTerm); }
08717 
08718 $   bool parentKilled = false;
08719 $   if (waitableParent && paused && _txNOP (_TX_ALLOW_KILL_PARENT))
08720         {
08721 $       parentKilled = _txKillProcess (parent);
08722 
08723 $       parent = 0;
08724 $       if (!parentKilled || _txIsParentWaitable (&parent))
08725             {$ PostMessage (console, WM_CHAR, '\n', 0); }
08726         }
08727 
08728 $   std::cout.flush();
08729 $   std::cerr.flush();
08730 $   std::clog.flush();
08731 $   _flushall();
08732 
08733 $   _txSymGetFromAddr (NULL);
08734 
08735     _TX_ON_DEBUG (OutputDebugString ("\n");
08736                   OutputDebugString (_TX_VERSION " - FINISHED: " _TX_MODULE "\n");
08737                   OutputDebugString ("\n"));
08738 
08739 $   if (parentKilled && _txWatchdogTimeout >= 0)
08740         {$ Win32::_beginthread (_txWatchdogTerminator, 0, &_txWatchdogTimeout); }
08741     }
08742 
08743 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08744 
08745 int _txSetFinishedText (HWND wnd)
08746     {
08747     struct tools
08748         {
08749         static LRESULT getWindowText (HWND window, wchar_t text[], size_t size)
08750             {
08751 $3          memset (text, 0, size * sizeof (*text));
08752 
08753 $           return SendMessageTimeoutW (window, WM_GETTEXT, (WPARAM) size, (LPARAM) text, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL);
08754             }
08755 
08756         static LRESULT setWindowText (HWND window, wchar_t text[])
08757             {
08758 $1          return SendMessageTimeoutW (window, WM_SETTEXT, 0,             (LPARAM) text, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL);
08759             }
08760         };
08761 
08762 $1  static wchar_t title [_TX_BUFSIZE+15] = L"TXLib";
08763 
08764 $   tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
08765 $   int len = (int) wcslen (title); if (len >= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE) len = _TX_BUFSIZE-1;
08766 
08767 $   MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, " [ЗАВЕРШЕНО]", -1, title + len, (int)_TX_BUFSIZE - len);
08768 
08769 $   tools::setWindowText (wnd, title);
08770 $   tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
08771 $   if (len <= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE-1-2 && title [len+2] == (wchar_t) 0x0417 /* 'З' */) return 0;
08772 
08773 $   MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, " [FINISHED]",  -1, title + len, (int)_TX_BUFSIZE - len);
08774 
08775 $   tools::setWindowText (wnd, title);
08776 $   tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
08777 $   if (len <= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE-1-2 && title [len+2] == /* 'F' */ (wchar_t) 0x0046) return 1;
08778 
08779 $   return 2;
08780     }
08781 
08782 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08783 
08784 void _txPauseBeforeTermination (HWND canvas)
08785     {
08786 $3  while (_kbhit()) (void)_getch();
08787 
08788 $   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO con = {};
08789 $   bool kbRedir = !GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE), &con);
08790 $   bool kbWait  = (_txGetInput() == EOF);
08791 $   bool wine    = !!Win32::wine_get_version;
08792 
08793 $   if (kbWait && !canvas && !kbRedir && !wine)
08794         {
08795 $       txSetLocale();
08796 
08797 $       fprintf (stderr, (!_txErrors? "\n" "[Нажмите любую клавишу для завершения]" :
08798                                       "\n" "[Press F to Pay Respects...]"));  // https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/press-f-to-pay-respects
08799 $       fflush  (stderr);
08800         }
08801 
08802 $   for (int i = 1; ; i++)
08803         {
08804 $       Sleep (_txWindowUpdateInterval);
08805 
08806         if (!kbWait || (kbRedir && !canvas)) {$ break; }  // No need to run and hide
08807 
08808         if (!wine && _txGetInput() != EOF)   {$ break; }  // Somebody hit something.
08809 
08810         if (canvas && !_txCanvas_ThreadId)   {$ break; }  // There was a window, and now there is not.
08811 
08812         if (!Win32::GetConsoleWindow())      {$ break; }  // Console was destroyed
08813 
08814         if (_TX_CALL (Win32::GhostWindowFromHungWindow, (canvas)))
08815             {$ TX_ERROR ("Программа зависла и будет завершена."); break; }
08816 
08817         if (canvas && _TX_CALL (Win32::IsHungAppWindow, (canvas)))
08818             {$ _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Программа-таки зависла и будет завершена."); break; }
08819 
08820         if (canvas && !SendMessageTimeout (canvas, WM_NULL, 0,0, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL))
08821             {$ _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Программа не отвечает и будет завершена.");  break; }
08822 
08823         if (!wine && !(i % 100500))
08824             {$ fprintf (stderr, "\r" "[Так нажмите же какую-нибудь клавишу для моего завершения]"); }
08825         }
08826 
08827 $   while (!wine && _kbhit()) (void)_getch();
08828 
08829 $   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
08830     }
08831 
08832 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08833 
08834 int _txGetInput()
08835     {
08836 $4  HANDLE con = GetStdHandle (STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
08837 
08838 $   DWORD nChars = 0;
08839 $   if (GetConsoleMode (con, &nChars) == 0 &&
08840         PeekNamedPipe  (con, NULL, 0, NULL, &nChars, NULL))
08841         {
08842 $       return (nChars)? fgetc (stdin) : EOF;
08843         }
08844 
08845 $   if (_kbhit())
08846         {
08847 $       return _getch();
08848         }
08849 
08850 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER < 1700)
08851 
08852 $   if (fseek (stdin, 1, SEEK_CUR) != EOF)
08853         {
08854 $       (void) fseek (stdin, -1, SEEK_CUR);
08855 $       return fgetc (stdin);                              // This causes blocking in MSVC 2011 beta
08856         }
08857 
08858 #endif
08859 
08860 $   return EOF;
08861     }
08862 
08863 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08864 
08865 int _txIsParentWaitable (DWORD* parentPID /*= NULL*/)
08866     {
08867 $4  PROCESSENTRY32* info = _txFindProcess();
08868 $   if (!info) return 0;
08869 
08870 $   info = _txFindProcess (info->th32ParentProcessID);
08871 $   if (!info) return 0;
08872 
08873 $   char parent [MAX_PATH] = "";
08874 $   strncpy_s (parent, sizeof (parent), info->szExeFile, sizeof (parent) - 1);
08875 $   if (parentPID) *parentPID = info->th32ProcessID;
08876 
08877 $   info = _txFindProcess (info->th32ParentProcessID);          // info: grandparent
08878 
08879 $   char list[_TX_BUFSIZE] = _TX_WAITABLE_PARENTS;
08880 $   char* ctx = NULL;
08881 
08882 $   for (char* p = strtok_s (list, ", ", &ctx); p; p = strtok_s (NULL, ", ", &ctx))
08883         {
08884 $       char* gp = strchr (p, ':');
08885 
08886 $       if (gp)
08887             {
08888 $           *gp++ = 0;
08889 
08890 $           if (_stricmp (p, parent) != 0) { continue; }
08891 
08892 $           if (info) if (_stricmp (gp, info->szExeFile) == 0)  // Was &&, but MSVC /analyze is so paranoid
08893                 {$ return islower ((unsigned char) *gp)? +1 : -1; }
08894             }
08895         else
08896             {
08897 $           if (_stricmp (p, parent) == 0)
08898                 {$ return islower ((unsigned char)  *p)? +1 : -1; }
08899             }
08900         }
08901 
08902 $   return 0;
08903     }
08904 
08905 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08906 
08907 void _txWatchdogTerminator (void* timeout)  // Or Watchcat? Possibly will change in future versions
08908     {
08909 $3  if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (timeout)) return;
08910 
08911 $   Sleep (*(int*) timeout);
08912 
08913 $   OutputDebugString ("\n");
08914     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Timeout (%d) expired, activating. %s\n",  // Kinda static reflection...
08915                          _TX_VERSION, __func__, *(int*) timeout, ((__func__[8] == 'd')? "Bark, bark" : "Meow, meow"));
08916 $   DWORD parent = 0;
08917 $   if (_txIsParentWaitable (&parent))
08918         {
08919         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Calling _txKillProcess (0x%04lu)\n",
08920                              _TX_VERSION, __func__, (unsigned long) parent);
08921 
08922 $       _txKillProcess (parent);
08923 
08924 $       PostMessage (GetConsoleWindow(), WM_CHAR, '\n', 0);
08925         }
08926 
08927     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Calling Win32::TerminateProcess (EXIT_FAILURE)\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__);
08928 $   Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), EXIT_FAILURE);
08929     }
08930 
08931 #endif // TX_COMPILED
08932 
08933 //}
08934 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08935 
08936 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08937 //{          Tools
08938 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08939 
08940 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08941 
08942 // You are here, little hacker?
08943 
08944 int _txTaskKill (const char i[] /*= NULL*/,
08945                  const char doYouWantToFindSomethingInTheCommandLineIDidSomethingForYouToFindSomethingInTheCommandLineMaybeYouWillFindSomeInterestingInTheCommandLineSoIDidSomethingForYouInTheCommandLine[] /*= NULL*/,
08946                  unsigned   x   /*= 0*/)
08947     {
08948     // ...so tired of it already...
08949 
08950     #define name          i  // Great name!
08951     #define cmdLineSubstr doYouWantToFindSomethingInTheCommandLineIDidSomethingForYouToFindSomethingInTheCommandLineMaybeYouWillFindSomeInterestingInTheCommandLineSoIDidSomethingForYouInTheCommandLine
08952     #define pid           x  // Another great name, isn't it?
08953 
08954 $3  if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED ((name || cmdLineSubstr || pid) && "Вот такие тут интересные имена встречаются...")) return false;
08955 
08956 $   wchar_t cmdLineSubstrW[_TX_BUFSIZE] = L"";
08957     if (cmdLineSubstr) {$ MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, cmdLineSubstr, -1, cmdLineSubstrW, sizearr (cmdLineSubstrW)); }
08958 
08959 $   HANDLE sshot = CreateToolhelp32Snapshot (TH32CS_SNAPPROCESS, 0);
08960 $   assert (sshot); if (!sshot) return 0;
08961 
08962 $   int killed = 0;
08963
